notes: Weapons seizure: Around 19 May 2023 (as reported), police seized 148 illegally owned guns within a period of three weeks, across the 6 counties affected by the pastoral militia, out of which 96 were surrendered by suspected Samburu militia (coded to county headquarters as Maralal, Samburu Central, Samburu) following the ongoing security operation against pastoral militia that has resulted in the displacement of populations and destruction of property.

On or before November 8, 2019, police clashed with cattle raiders at an unspecified location on the Meru side of the Meru-Isiolo border (coordinates for Ndumuru, Meru county, used at prec2). Reports suggest that gunfire was involved, though police have denied this.

On 5 November 2019, an unidentified armed group (described as 'bandits' it some sources) ambushed a vehicle in Kukuto area of Marsabit county (coordinates for Jaldesa used at prec2), killing at least three.

On 5 November 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked Jaldesa (Marsabit county), killing at least 7, including 2 police who were engaged in a firefight with the attackers. The attack is said to be retaliatory in nature, though there is no further information.

On 29 October 2019, gunmen ambushed a convoy of vehicles carrying mirra (khat) into Baragoi (Samburu county, coordinates used at prec2). The attackers killed one driver and wounded four others. The attackers released the convoy after looting from it, telling the survivors they were not the inteded target.

29 October 2019. In Dhobley, an armed group attacked Kenyan military forces, two people were killed.
On Oct 23th 2019, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a matatu vehicle in Mandera. The driver managed to speed up avoiding bullets hitting passengers.

Around Sept 21st 2019, Hulugho villagers were reportedly attacked by the military, who descended on their village at midnight and indiscriminately opened fire. According to pictures circulating on the following days, one man was shot in the head.

06 November. Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at a residence of a traditional elder in Belet hawa town. No casualties reported.

On 4 November 2018, clash between suspected pastoralists from Lagdera and Uchana communities in Mado Gashi market (Isiolo) after an earlier 'botched raid' by the Lagdera in Mata Bofu. One person was injured.
On 4 November 2018, two people were wounded in a 'botched raid' at Mata Bofu, likey in Isiolo south. The attackers were believed to be pastoralists from Lagdera in Garissa county.

On 3 November 2018, clashes between pastoralist communities from Lagdera in Garissa county and Uchana in Isiollo. Two members of the Ladgera died in the skirmish, whilst two local militiamen were injured. It is unclear what caused the clash. This came amidst tensions in Garba Tula as approx 250 people displaced from Eldera over land were refusing to move from Garba Tula.

26 October. A driver was killed, and his vehicle was stolen by al Shabaab fighters at the vicinity of Belethawa town. The driver was offloading sacks of khat in Garbaharrey and was on his way back to Belet-hawa district when AS fighters, on a motorbike, ambushed his vehicle.
On 19 October 2018, at least three people, all civilians, were killed and several wounded in an airstrike carried out by unidentified warplanes in Bula-Hajji town of Lower Jubba region.

On or before October 17th, two people were killed in a clash in Jaldesa (Marsabit), and two police reservists were wounded in the crossfire. The violence comes amidst recent ethnically-motivated clashes in the area. A number of local politicians have been questioned.

During the week beginning October 15th, clashes occurred at an unspecified location in Marsabit amidst ethnic violence. 10 killed (coded as 8 here and 2 for a clash in Jaldesa). Two local politicians were arrested on October 22nd over their alleged role in the violence.

On 16 October 2018, Al Shabaab militants alleged that they had destroyed two Kenyan military vehicles with an IED, killing and injuring an unspecified number of soldiers. The alleged incident took place between Fino and Arabiya villages in Mandera county (coordinates for Fino, Mandera, used). Subsequent reports indicate that the IED exploded before the military vehicles were in range, resulting in no casualties or fatalities.

On 14 October 2018, an RCIED, planted in a residence structure, exploded in Belethawa (Belet Xaawo) town. The target was believed to be Celi Dhere sub clan elders meeting inside the residence. There were no reports of causalities.
On 14 October 2018, fighting between Kenyan Military and Al-Shabab fighters was reported in El Wak (Ceel Waaq) district of Gedo Region.

On 12 October 2018, an armed group attacked Shurr village in Marsabit county (coordinates for the state capital of Marsabit town used). In the ensuing gunfight, three residents of the town were killed, as was one of the attackers. The source describes the clash as being 'ethnic' in nature.

11 October 2018: Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike raid against Al-Shabaab targets in Kukuma village (c. 30 km south of Ceel Waaq district, approx. Coordinates used). One civilian was injured in the strike. Approximate coordinates used.

actor2: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a Jubaland police post in Diff village (c. 65 km north of Dooley town), sparking armed clashes. The Al-Shabaab fighters managed to take control of the post after only a few minutes of fighting, withdrawing a few hours later. No info on casualties.

On 10 October 2018, around twenty militants suspected to belong to Al Shabaab attacked a school in Lafey (Mandera). The militants targeted non-Muslim staff, and threw an explosive device into quarters used by non-Muslim teachers, killing two.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 4 October 2018: Jubaland forces clashed with AS taxation group at Didi-ado grazing area (c. 13 km east of Kulbiyow). There was a brief heavy exchange of gunfire after which AS retreated from the area. Three AS fighters and one JSF soldier were killed while one JSF soldier sustained injuries.
On or before October 2nd, Kenyan security services fired at civilians in Madera county (precise location unspecified). At least one person was injured.
On or before October 2nd, Al Shabaab forces shelled a Kenyan military base in Mirarani (Lamu county). Casualties mentioned (unknown death or injuries coded as zero fatalaties).

Around 1 October 2018 (as reported), military officers beat up local residents, torched houses and burnt livestock in El Wak (Mandera South, Mandera), after an IED was found on Elwak Kutollow road. One person died while 17 others sustained injuries during the incident.
27 September 2018: Three civilians were killed and 6 others wounded when an IED device exploded in a restaurant in Al-Waq town, Gedo. Al-Shabaab was blamed for the attack.

27 September 2018: Following an IED landmine attack the day before, Kenyen security forces raided the Daba city village in Mandara county and beat local residents with clubs and kicking them. At least 22 unarmed civilians were hurt during the event.
26 September 2018: An IED hit a Kenyan military vehicle in Daba-city village in Mandera County.
25 September 2018: Al-Shabaab forces reportedly killed a Kenyan soldier in Lamu county (location unspecified by the source).

On 25 September 2018, a pro-Al Shabaab radio station reported that Al Shabaab forces had attacked a KDF camp at Taksile, north of Lamu (coordinates for Lamu used). According to the source, 10 KDF soldiers were killed, and three Al Shabaab fighters were also killed.

24 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militants claim to have overrun a Kenyan military base in Taksile area north of Pandaguo, Lamu County, killing 10 Kenyan soldiers and admitting three deaths among their own ranks. Kenyan military sources also reported the clashes, although they claimed that 10 Al-Shabaab fighters had been killed. Fatalities coded at the most conservative estimate.

On 24 September 2018, KDF soldiers attacked an Al Shabaab hideout at Taksile, north of Lamu (coordinates for Lamu used), killing 10 Al Shabaab fighters, and seizing weapons and ammunition. 3 KDF soldiers were reported to have been injured in the attack and weapons were recovered.

On 22 September 2018, local labourers of a Chinese company contracted to lay tarmac on Suguta-Maralal road staged a protest in front of Sino Hydro's office in Maralal town denouncing poor working conditions and non-payment of overtime.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 18 September 2018: Jubaland Darwish troops have attacked an Al-Shabaab position in Belet Xaawo, sparking clashes that led to the death of 11 Al-Shabaab fighters and a reported 10 members of the Darwish troops. Darwish troops have now taken control of the area, which is located in an unspecified area south of Belet Xaawo.

The group claim to have killed and injured 15 soldiers. Fatalities coded as 7. The attack began with a bomb attack which was followed by an exchange of gunfire.

notes: 16 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militants have reportedly shelled Kenyan troops in a base in Buusaar in Elwak District, Gedo.

At some point during the middle of September, two communal militias clashed in the village of Oronderi in Marsabit county (coordinates for the state capital of Marsabit town used), reportedly over a land dispute. No further detail is provided in the source.
On 14 September 2018, eight Al Shabaab gunmen ambushed a bus near Ijara, heading to Garissa. They profiled people travelling on the bus and killed two non-local passengers.

13 September 2018: Police forces opened fire at rioters throwing rocks at police officers in the town of El Wak, killing at least one person. Rioters then entered the hospital compound and attacked non-locals, killing two and seriously injuring a third. They were demonstrating against the death of three people who they said were killed by security officers a day before. Coded as two separate events, one riot and one VAC event.

notes: 13 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly shelled an AMISOM base located in the Busaar village, Ceel Waaq district of Gedo. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

12 September 2018: Security forces reportedly arrested a family of 5 in the town of El-Wak. Three of those arrested were later found dead, and local civilians have accused security forces of being responsible for their deaths.
11 September. A young man was killed in Moyale town by a member of the Defence Force. The shooting occurred when securities tried to queel a fight between Somali and Oromo communities.
On or before 11 September. Youth from Region 5 (Somali Region of Ethiopia) clashed with Oromo youths in Moyale.

On 11 September 2018, a police vehicle belonging to the Anti-Stock Theft Unit was hit by an explosion in Kotulo ward (Wajir). They began searching for suspects afterwards. There were no reports of police injuries or deaths.

On 11 September 2018, police apprehended four members of the same family at Qababa village in Elram (Kotulo ward, Wajir). One was beaten before being released, and the other three were found dead the following day. All had been shot in the head. The police were conducting a search operation in the area following an attack on a police vehicle the same day.
On or around 7 Sept 2018, tribal clashes erupted in Marsabit county following the recent killing of two people near Maasai Mau forest in Narok county.

On 5 September 2018, two people were killed following armed clashes between Gabra and Borana pastoralist militia over pasture in Horonder, between Moyale and Marsabit. The first person died during clashes on 5 Sept, while the second passed away the following morning. Three other people were wounded.

On or before September 3rd, herders grazing their cattle in Boni Forest (Garissa county) were reportedly detained and beaten by the Kenyan military. At least eight herders were beaten, some seriously, and they have been separated from their cattle. The KDF denied that it was conducted any operations in the area.

On or before 02 September. At least 4 Somalis of the Gare clan killed in Moyale. Moyale has consistently been hit with inter ethnic conflict and border dispute between the Borana Oromo Qero and Somali residents of the area.

On 29 August 2018, five Kenyan soldiers were killed and ten wounded when their vehicle hit a landmine on the road between Kiunga and Sankuri (Lamu, coordinates for Kiunga used). It was not clear who had planted the device, though a pro-Al Shabaab radio station in Somalia subsequently claimed that Al Shabaab had killed at least 20 Kenyan soldiers in an (unverified) attack in the area of Lamu, which was reported to be an ambush. Until further information comes to light, this has been coded as a single event of remote violence by an unknown group, killing five.
On or before August 27th, protestors in Kiambere (Embu County, approximate coordinates used) demonstrated against KenGen's failure to supply the area with clean drinking water, and electricity.

Arrests: On or before August 27th, counter-terror police arrested seven individuals suspected of being affiliated to Al Shabaab, in Ijara sub-county (Garissa county). Three of the suspects were later released.
26 August 2018: Protests against government interference in Jubaland and Gedo region took place in Dhobley.

Property destruction: on August 24th, and according to an Al Shabaab commander, the group destroyed power stations in Lamu town and Tana River town (for the latter, the location of Hola has been used). There has been no confirmation of this claim in other sources.

On 16 August 2018, a public service vehicle travelling from Elwak to Mandera was attacked by unidentified gunmen. Three passengers were left in a critical condition.

Security measures: On 6 August, a new police border patrol unit with camels has been established to patrol remote sections of the Kenya-Somali border in Isiolo County.

26 July. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a group of police in Milihoi. One dead, two injured. Security forces added personnel to the region in response.
On 26 July 2018, Kenyan Soldiers (KDF) reportedly raped 5 women who were living near the Belet Xawo town located near the Kenya/Somalia border. All 5 were later hospitalized in Kenya.
On 25 July 2018, unidentified individuals set ablaze a dormitory at Madogo secondary school (Bura, Tana River). The school closed indefinitely.
Property destruction: On 25 July 2018, unidentified individuals set ablaze a dormitory at Madogo secondary school (Bura, Tana River). The school closed indefinitely.

24 July. Kenyan defence forces were reported to have destroyed a communication mast in Samaroole, about 18 kilometres away from the border town of El-Wak, reason unknown. Two of the mast's security guards were killed in the attack.

There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for a few minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties.

On 16 July 2018, an IED intended to target Kenya soldiers exploded after their vehicle had passed the device, on the road between Tarbaj and Kutulo (Tarbaj coded as the location, with coordinates of the site of the attack accurate to 3km taken from the source). There were no casualties, and the source attributes the attack to Al Shabaab.

12 July. Rural Border Patrol Unit repulsed an attempted al Shabaab attack on their camp at Manza in Sheikh Barrow (coordinates approx), Mandera County. No police injury; al Shabaab casualty not known.

10 July. Al Shabaab elements raid Hamey police post in Loboi, Garissa post during the early morning hours. A gunbattle ensued. One officer missing, four others wounded. Al Shabaab also destroyed communication masts in the area. A second report indicates al Shabaab overran the post, killing three officers and stealing weapons.

On 2 July 2018, a Kenyan military vehicle was hit by an IED (the source attributes the attack to Al Shabaab) on the road between Mandera and Lafey, 5km from Lafey. 21 June. 05 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of Ceel Waaq town. Three hours later, al Shabaab withdrew from the town. Al Shabaab fighters amassed again around the town three days later with the believed aim of overtaking the village for the second time in a week.

11 April. Two people were killed and seven others injured after armed men raided Salima village in Laisamis sub county on April 11, 2018. The attack is believe to be linked to a rivalry between two communities. The attack is believed to be related to an attack in the area under similar circumstances three days prior
Weapons seizure: 11 April. Police forces dismantle an al Shabaab camp in Ijara. No arrests reported, though a number of weapons were recovered.
08 April. Three members of the same family are killed in an attack based on community rivalry in or near Salima village in Laisamis sub county.

notes: 05 April. Two roadside IEDs have immobilised two KDF vehicles near Dhobley. Causality figures, perpetrators not known.

Around 5 April 2018 (as reported), unidentified armed individuals ambushed a group of police officers near Wamba (Wamba East, Samburu East, Samburu) during a cattle raid. 3 police officers and 1 peace crusader were killed while 5 others were seriously injured.
03 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a SNAF convoy near Buusaar. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

02 April. Al Shabaab attacked a military base at Busaar. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. At least one confirmed death.

notes: 31 March. Jubaland forces clash with another Jubaland soldier who attempted to hijack a civilian vehicle. The soldier targeted was injured.

28 March. Six people were killed and two others seriously injured in a militia attack near Kenyan border with Ethiopia. Occurring in Chiroqo, Banisa Sub County, most of the victims come from Degodia clan who have been having disputes with Garre community.

On 27 March 2018, two suspected Kenyans from the Garre clan were killed in Ethiopia (Adilli, Oromia) while riding a motorcycle by suspected members of the Kenyan Degodia clan. The attack took place near the border with Kenya. Retaliatory clashes occurred in Kenya the following days.
26 March. Al Shabaab fighters fire several mortar rounds towards a military base at Hosingow, followed by probing attack. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.
24 March. Cattle herders killed 10 in Lopurio area in Samburu North in communal violence.

24 March. KDF attempts to continue building the security fence on the Somali Kenya boarder meets resistance from locals who claim the fence is annexing parts of Somalia. There were reported injuries between locals and KDF forces erecting the border.

21 March. KDF troops conducted an attack against al Shabaab fighters at Wardenle village, 30 km north of Cel Waaq. A warplane (unknown origin, however Kenya operates aircraft in this region) launched an airstrike targeting al Shabaab fighters followed by a KDF infantry troop attack. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters have not been confirmed at the time of reporting.

13 March. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of KDF forces outside on Ceel Waaq. The ensuing clash lasted for several hours. Several vehicles were destroyed. Causalities not known.

11 March. Security forces kill one and injure another in Moyale the day following a series of attacks which killed between 9-13.

On 3 July 2018, a bomb disposal squad from the Kenya Defence Forces succesfully defused an IED (the source attributes Al Shabaab as being responsible for placing the device) in between Sangailu and Hangaro (Sangailu coded as the location, with coordinates for the precise site accurate to 5km taken from the source).
Al Shabaab fighters attack Fino, Mandera. Four police and one reservist killed, two police missing.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an KDFconvoy at a grazing area near Sheebow village (c. 18 km south east of Ceel Waaq town). The ambush was initiated by an IED that targeted the convoy followed by heavy armed clash that lasted for hours. Subsequently, al Shabaab withdrew after warplanes (not identified) reportedly arrived at the location of the incident. There were no reports of casualties.

On 24 February 2018, presumed MCC supporters allied to a member of parliament demonstrated by waving placards, carrying twigs and singing songs of justice, as they marched to the constituency offices in Mpeketoni (Lamu West, Lamu), against the court's decision to nullify his election. The group demanded justice for their MP.

'One INGO male staff member needed medical attention after he was shot twice by armed perpetrators who ambushed the organization's vehicle. The staff members (five in total but only one was wounded) were in the vicinity of Darer Dima and traveling from Malkadaka to Garbatulla when they were attacked. Nothing was stolen from the passengers. While it was reported that the aid workers did not appear to be targeted specifically for their affiliation to an aid organization and that there has been an increase in insecurity in greater Isiolo county, it should also be noted that the vehicle was clearly marked.'

A man who was killed had his eyes gouged out while a pregnant woman is shot and her body mutilated at Malkagufu area. The attack is believed to be related to clashes between Degodia and Arjuran groups since December. It is not clear who the victim/perpetrator is in this instance. The attack occurred on or before 20/02.

Seven suspects believed to be part of a group of militants arrested in Isiolo County last week were arrested by security officers in Mbarambate, Garbatulla. Two others were shot and killed while trying to escape.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Qarsa Primary School in Wajir. Three teachers killed, one injured. Assailants escaped.
15/02, PM Wajir: Al Shabaab attack a school killing 3 teachers.

On 15 February 2018, police shot dead a man, part of four other Al-Shabaab operatives at Mataarba area in Merti (Merti, Isiolo). The rest of the associates managed to escape. Police recovered more than 1,000 bullets, 36 grenades, 18 IEDs, 5 AK-47 rifles and an assortment of other weapons.
Interception: On 15 February 2018, police officers intercepted a vehicle in Merti (Cherab, Merti, Isiolo) loaded with 80 kgs of TNT. 4 people were arrested.

Two Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) soldiers have been killed during a shootout between them and police officers at Sheikh Barrow in Mandera County. The exchange may have been a case of mistaken identity.
Al Shabaab fire several mortar rounds towards KDF base in El Ram, Mandera County. No casualties, assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab launched mortar file against a military base in El Wak over two days. Casualties reported, number not provided.
Al Shabaab launched mortar file against a military base in El Wak over two days. Casualties reported, number not provided.

Residents of Witu protest on 09/02 and 11/02 against the government appointment of an area chief.
Al Shabaab attacks a military camp at Kutulo, Wajir during the morning hours. The bodies of three belonging to the attackers were later found in the area.
IED targets Kenya Police land cruiser headed to location of previous al Shabaab attack near Kutulo. No casualties & no damages.

Reports coming from Elwaq town, [Gedo region, southwestern Somalia] located on the Somali-Kenya border say Kenyan [military] helicopters carried out air strikes at an area known as Kalabayrka. The area is 8km from Elwaq town. No casualties reported, but following the air strikes [al Shabaab] fled the area.

Unknown warplanes conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab location at weel-buraad grazing area (c. 35 km south east of Dhobley town). At least two missiles were fired at the targeted area. Casualties from the attack was unknown.
02/02, Ceel Waq: SNA forces withdraw, followed by al Shabaab recapturing the town.
KDF combat helicopters attack al Shabaab positions between Ceel Waaq and Buusaar. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

On 1 February 2018, residents barricaded the Garissa Nairobi road with stones and bonfires at Madogo (Bura, Tana River) in a demonstration against the alleged killing of two night guards. Running battles between the group and the police ensued. No details on injuries.

Lamu County health workers took to the streets of Lamu Island to demonstrate against recent allegations that they were complicit in Al Shabaab activities. The doctors, clinical officers, nurses and lab technicians from various hospitals, dispensaries and health centres across Lamu also marched to Lamu County Commissioner Gilbert Kitiyo's office.

On 29 January 2018, one civilian was killed and three more wounded in Moyale town, in southern Ethiopia, when security forces opened fire at a group of youngsters returning from a local football match.

Two soldiers were killed after their truck ran over an Improvised Explosive Device at Handaro, Holugho sub-county, Garissa County. Three other soldiers who tried to jump off the vehicle were reportedly shot at close range by the suspected militia and were seriously wounded.
KDF shell suspected al Shabaab positions near Buusaar. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

Hundreds of civilian villagers gathered in front of AMISOM KDF/Jubaland force base in Hosungo village to protest the arrest of a civilian male who was alleged to have connection with al Shabaab (c. 80 km south east of Dhobley town.) The demonstration occurred after the suspect was taken to AMISOM Dhobley base for further inquiry. There were no reports of security incidents during the period of the demonstration.

A Kenyan official says four children have been killed by an explosive device that went off in a field where they grazing livestock. Mandera Governor Ali Roba is blaming devices that Britain might have planted during its colonial occupation of Kenya for the deaths on Saturday. He asked security agents to clear the fields of any devices from before Kenya gained independence in 1963.

Property destruction: Al-Shabab militants have destroyed a Hormuud communication mast located on the Somalia border town of Elwak. Police say the militants were retaliating to earlier reports of locals communicating with Somalia security forces and the Kenya Amisom troops.
Anti-government demonstration occur 'at the weekend.' At least one death reported at the hands of security forces.
Locals have reported the KDF of carrying out an airstrike in the vicinity of the town of Ceel Wak. A number of al Shabaab allegedly reside in the town. Causalities not known.

In Ishakani Village in Lamu East, more than 100 heavily armed insurgents took over the area and preached radical teachings to the residents. They hoisted their flag at a deserted local police station before going back to their hideouts. Sources revealed that the attackers have also been conducting daily prayers at mosques in the area at will.

Youngsters gathered to protest against the arrests of three people for Saturday's events.
People violently demonstrated against the arrest of a local sheikh and destroyed property, especially churches. Three dead.
Kenyan officials said a civilian was killed and several policemen wounded when suspected members of the Somalia-based group al-Shabaab attacked a convoy of vehicles.
One Somali soldier is dead following a clash with al Shabaab in Ceel Waaq.

At least six missiles were fired which resulted in slight injuries to a civilian local pastoralist. The injured victim was taken to Diif for treatment.

Jubaland force detained their vehicles. Other reports indicated that clashes were ongoing outside of the village. One soldier was killed and another was injured during the second armed clash.

Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and their two AK47s were confiscated. The road from Kismayo to Qooqani was not accessible to government and AMISOM troops since 2012 due to al Shabaab presence. The motive of the soldiers who decided to abandon their base in Kismayo and move to Diif village was not clear. It was believed that there were internal clan disputes and differences within Jubbaland authorities in Kismayo.

Al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Kenyan police station located along the common border in Mandera on 2 January. 'Reports from al-Shabab Mujahideen say that six soldiers (police) were killed in the attack with one being the commander of the police in the area, four were killed in the raid on the police camp while two other soldiers were killed in an ambush while they were rushing to back up their colleagues from El Waq town,' the website reported.

Kenya Defence Forces soldiers killed five suspected al-Shabab militants believed to have been involved in the attack on Ijara Police Station in Garissa. KDF said a vehicle that had been taken away by the militants during the attack on the Ijara station on Saturday, 30 December was destroyed after explosives it was carrying exploded during a gunfight that ensued between the soldiers and the militants.

Al Shabaab terrorists have set on fire two police camps in Ijara, in the latest attack from the Somalia-based militant group. The attackers also destroyed the main communication equipment used in the town before speeding off with a police land cruiser which is yet to be recovered. A senior police officer briefed on the matter has told Capital News beat that no casualty was reported in the attack.

Reports from Lamu Island say a deadly attack was carried out in parts of the island. The attack was a well-planned ambush targeting a vehicle carrying 'Kenyan crusaders' travelling on the road that connects Mwitu and Gamba villages in Lamu county. Al-Shabab forces, who are waging jihad in Lamu, captured the vehicle and two Kenyan infidels, who are among those settled in the Muslim land of Lamu.
KDF air forces bomb an al Shabaab location at Bohadi, which is believed to be near Ceel Waaq on 28/12. Causalities reported, numbers unknown.

24th December, Beled Xawo, Gedo: Complaints over the demarcation of a Kenyan built security wall being built on the Somali Kenyan border have reportedly turned violent, with Somali protestors amassing and throwing stones.

Schoolchildren were playing with a device when it exploded. At least five children have been killed in an explosion in Banisa, Mandera County. Banisa Sub-County Deputy County Commissioner Mathias Chisambo said the schoolchildren were playing with a grenade they had found in a grazing field.
Regime security forces killed 7 civilians on Monday as they protested the killing of protesters in Chelenko on 11/12. The number of fatalities was spread among two cities, Yabello and Moyale.

Kenya's security forces on Monday destroyed six Al-Shabaab training camps in an ongoing operation to flush out militants from the vast Boni forest in the coastal town of Lamu. 'Many' Al-Shabaab militants were killed and others injured during the operation.

Detonation: An explosive thrown from a moving car hit the perimeter wall of a church, causing a security scare in Mandera Town. The device, according to an eyewitness, exploded immediately after the speeding Toyota Probox turned at a corner.

Women in Garissa held a peaceful march to demonstrate their commitment to preventing gender based violence.

Three student from Isiolo Barracks Secondary School are in police custody after they allegedly attacked a soldier. The Form Four students were passing through the gate from their school after doing their national examinations when they assaulted the officer and caused disturbance.

'A truck contracted by a UN agency partner in Garissa county ran over an IED planted in the road. All three contracted employees sustained major injuries as a result of the attack. Although no group claimed responsibility for the attack, the area is prone to extremist activities by Al-Shabaab. The workers were delivering food commodities at the time.'

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an SNA force position located between Dhobley airfield and the UN way station in Dhobley town. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.
Unidentified attackers shot at a bus that was travelling from Merti to Isiolo, killing 8 passengers.

Attack without casualties: Al Shabaab members carjacked a vehicle transporting khat near Damase Village (c. 60 km South West of Cel Waaq district). The vehicle was destroyed by al Shabaab using explosives. The whereabouts of the driver and passengers were unknown.

Transport in Mandera County has been paralysed after operators suspended bus services in the county for three days after al-Shabab attacked two police vehicles on Monday evening. Al-Shabab militants ambushed and burnt down two police land cruisers in an attack in Daba City, Mandera County on Monday. The two vehicles carrying police officers were escorting a bus to Mandera when they were hit by rocket-propelled grenades. 12 killed, several wounded.

The KDF intercepted an Al Shabaab group of militants who was heavily armed and planning to carry out attacks in Lamu West on Thursday. An operation (Linda Boni) was called to capture the militants who escaped during the gun battle into the Boni forest. During the incident, six AK-47 assault rifles, 321 bullets, three grenades and explosives were recovered.
Al Shabaab militants attacked a land cruiser in Arabia. They stole the land cruiser and shot at the passengers. 2 passengers were injured.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car and abducted a driver between Fino and Sheikh Barrow. He is alive, but being held in Somalia.
A Land Cruiser carrying five passengers was attacked by Al Shabaab militants at Arabia area. The driver was released and two passengers suffered gunshot wounds but they were in stable condition.

Belet Xawo, Gedo region: Kenyan aircraft carried out two airstrikes against al Shabaab at Buursagar and Habar near Belet Xawo. 16 al Shabaab killed and 10 injured.

An IED, planted near the Somali immigration office at the border of Belethawa town and the Kenyan border, exploded. There were no reports of casualties. There were no reports of arrests. Perpetrators not identified.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab temporarily captured the border town of Belet Xaawo after launching a large-scale complex attack. The attack began with an IED detonated at a police station. The source suggests 30 Somali soldiers may have been killed. Xinhua reported 26 government soldiers dead. Police and military forces re-gained control of the town in the evening hours. Al Shabaab destroyed much of the town upon their exit. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab temporarily captured the border town of Belet Xaawo after launching a large-scale complex attack. The attack began with an IED detonated at a police station. The source suggests 30 Somali soldiers may have been killed. Xinhua reported 26 government soldier dead. Police and military forces re-gained control of the town in the evening hours, causalities not known. Al Shabaab destroyed much of the town upon their exit. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

A gun battle was reported between police and Al Shabaab militants in Mandera Town Monday morning. Mandera County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said more security personnel had been deployed to secure the area but could not confirm if there were casualties so far.
Three people have been killed and eight others seriously injured in a banditry attack in Baragoi town, Samburu County

At least one police officer was killed and two others injured when the vehicle in which they were travelling ran over an improvised explosive device (IED) in the coastal Lamu County on Sunday evening.

Officers conducting the ongoing multi-agency security Operation in Lamu have discovered and destroyed three key Al-Shabaab hideouts at Lango la Simba in Witu Division of Lamu West. The raids took place on or before 10/09.

An official of Somali Region, Hudet woreda, Liben zone, was killed along with some militia men (numbers not known) on 09/09. The man was a head of Water and Rural Infrastructure of the woreda. The perpetrators are unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: In Moyale, Borana zone, Chamluk town 12 people were killed and 9 wounded during clashes between Liyu Police paramilitaries and Oromo people. Liyu police were supported by Ethiopian military army. People in the area have been evacuating in fear of continued clashes. Later in the day Liyu militias attacked from a state of retreat from the previous day. Liyu police later returned to the area, sparking clashes that reportedly killed up to 80 people - 60 Liyu police and 20 Oromos. (These numbers may be unreliable - a conservative estimate was made at 50, making the total for the day 62.)
On Sept. 7, at least four people were killed near Moyale when Oromo militia armed with machetes attacked patients in a hospital. The motive of the attack is believed to be revenge.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: Suspected Liyu Police paramilitary attack Moyale, leading to a clash from defending residents. Fatalities are believed to be about 30.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: Oromo militias pushed Liyu Police paramilitarie out of Chamuk. Several fatalities reported, though no numbers were provided.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in two villages in the Hindi area in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.
Residents in Hindi rioted and blockaded the road to protest the killing of people by Al Shabaab. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.
Refugees in the Dadaab Camp held a demonstration to protest against the renditioning of refugees to Ethiopia.
Al Shabaab kills three Kenyan construction engineers in Dhobley on the evening of 05/09. Security forces conducted a security sweep soon after.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for an alleged IED attack against a KDF convoy. Al Shabaab claimed one vehicle destroyed and 'several' casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab 'Somalimemo' website claimed responsibility for an alleged IED attack against a KDF convoy at Hosingow. Al Shabaab claimed one vehicle destroyed and 'several' casualties.
3 people were injured when a grenade exploded in Eskot market, in Garbatulla. The man carrying the grenade, a 32-year old chemist, was killed whilst holding it.

Al Shabaab fighters stormed into the homes of two prominent elders from Gare sub-clan and killed them in Ceel Waaq district. Al Shabaab displayed the body of the two prominent elders at Cel Waaq town. The two elders were allegedly affiliated with the government.
01st September, evening, Ceel Waaq, Gedo: suspected al Shabaab militants kidnapped two clan elders. The victims' bodies were discovered during the early hours of 02nd September.

Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) and police exchanged fire with Al Shabaab militants after they destroyed a telecommunication mast in Mandera County. The police reservists were overpowered by the attackers as they engaged in gunfight but none was injured during the 1:30 a.m. attack at Dabacity area. A loud explosion was heard and police reservists guarding the mast reported an attack at Dabacity by the militants but none of the police reservists was injured in the incident.

At least two KDF soldiers were killed on 28 August when their Armoured Personnel Carrier (APC) triggered off a roadside bomb explosion in Damasa Lafey Sub-County, Mandera [northeast of the country]. Three others were injured.

Kenyan forces clash with al Shabaab at Dhamase, along the Kenyan border near Ceel Waaq. Al Shabaab burnt a battle wagon belonging to KDF while seizing another lorry during the combat. Al Shabaab claimed 'many' Kenyan soldiers dead (coded as 10).
Afternoon, IVO Dhamaso, Gedo: al Shabaab fighters ambushed a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) convoy. Al Shabaab claimed to have killed five soldiers.

Local security forces on patrol shot and injured an al Shabaab member at Kaboley neighbourhood in Beled Hawa town. The al Shabaab member is believed to be visiting his family during the night. The local were informed of his arrival and followed him at his residence. Information indicates that he was instructed to surrender, but defied the order of the security forces. He was taken to Beled Hawa Police Station after the incident.

Property destruction: Al-Shabab fighters attacked the Kenyan village of Gamba in Tana River County [in the country's coastal region], targeting government installations in the area. The extent of the damage or whether anyone was killed or injured in the attack is not year clear. Phone networks in the area broke down after the raid.
The Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] on Sunday [20 August] resumed bombing Boni Forest which Al Shabaab has used as a base to launch attacks.
At least three people were killed on Friday by Al Shabaab militants in Witu Lamu County. The Star reports 4 dead.
Al Shabaab militants attacked Maleli village, near Witu town. They burned down houses and killed 4 people.
Women from Boni were abducted and held by Al Shabaab militants in a camp, where they were gang-raped and mistreated.
When the Jubilee candidate was declared winner of the Garissa governorship, opposition supporters rioted and burned down the Garissa market.

Five police officers have been killed by an Al-Shabaab IED while on patrol along Bothai-Ijara road, within Garissa County. One officer sustained injuries during the attack while another one managed to escape unhurt.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Ethiopia)
notes: ENDF convoy travelling to Buurdhuubo noticed 2 IEDs. Devices safely dismantled. Believing them responsible, three camel elders were tortured and assassinated by soldiers in the aftermath.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Ethiopia)
notes: Al Shabaab news propaganda reports Ethiopian forces killed four civilians at a watering hole in Maykaareebi on or before 12/08.

Drama ensued in Lamu West after the returning officer was prevented from announcing the final results for the parliamentary seat. Return was not possible because chaos erupted when the RO and the candidate began fighting, breaking ballot boxes in the process. A number of injuries were reported.
Police used teargas canisters to disperse clashes between rival political supporters.
Rioters against the presidential election results set grocery stalls on fire. The police dispersed the crowd.
An al Shabaab IED targets a civilian vehicle. Four passengers killed.

Five unidentified attackers armed with knives attacked a polling station where elections results were being tallied in Hola town, stabbing one person. Police intervened, shooting dead two of the assailants. The three others escaped.

Five unidentified attackers armed with knives attacked a polling station where elections results were being tallied in Hola town, stabbing one person. Police intervened, shooting dead two of the assailants. The three others escaped.
Suspected Al Shabaab militants hijacked 2 cars carrying voters between Omar Jillo and Lafey.
Two people were injured after the vehicle they were travelling in ran over a landmine at Nyongoro along the Garsen-Lamu road.
Al Shabaab militants destroyed an electricity pylon near Gamba, causing a blackout across Lamu county.
Police officers engaged in a shoot out with Al Shabaab, after a landmine injured civilians in Nyorongo
Youth in Garissa held a march to call for a peaceful election.
Al Shabab forces attacked the village of Damase in Garissa county and seized it fully after brief fighting with Kenyan police officers who fled the area during the fighting.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 03 Aug, c. 1245 hrs. GURA-ARBA: Jubbaland police forces at Diif village (c. 75 km North East of Dhobley) intercepted two al Shabaab suspects near Gur-Arba village (c. 22 km East of the Somali-Kenya border). There was a brief armed clash. An al Shabaab fighter, suspected to be from Tanzania, and a Jubbaland forces officer were reportedly killed. Jubbaland forces managed to apprehend the second AS fighter. Jubbaland forces recovered the body of the AS fighter, some Kenya Shilling and a number of pistols. The dead bodies and the detained AS fighter were taken to Dif village. Information indicated that the AS fighters were destined to cross the border into Kenyan territory.
A Police Officer was killed during an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab at Lafey police station. Some of Al-Shabaab members suffered injuries when police responded wih gunshots. A police car was stolen
Three people were killed and four injured after a passenger bus was ambushed by Al Shabaab.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car painted in Jubilee campaign colours in Falana, near Mandera. The driver and a passenger were kidnapped.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Early AM, Kolbiyow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked the Kenya Defence Force (KDF) base located near Kolbiyow. KDF forces conducted several sweep operations later this morning as a response to the attack. No causalities reported. The similar attack in the area occurred the previous day.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: A KDF convoy en route from Sariile to Kolbiyow hit by an al Shabaab IED. One vehicle destroyed, 2 KDF killed.
Supporters of the two candidates in Marsabit threw stones at each other in Marsabit where President Kenyatta was expected to rally on wedsnesday.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Early AM, Hosingow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) base. The assailants were repelled. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Early AM, Lagta, Lower Jubba: KDF fighter jets attacked an al Shabaab camp at Lagta, near Kolbiyow. The resulting causality figures not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Early AM, IVO Belet Xaawo, Gedo: four bodies of suspected al Shabaab fighters were discovered by residents. Jubaland authorities reported the four were killed during a 'recent' skirmish, date not provided. The Shabelle Media Network claims the four were executed by Jubaland forces.

Jubilee Party campaigns in Mandera turned chaotic after two rival camps clashed at Moi stadium ahead of a rally led by President Uhuru Kenyatta. The two camps, Jubilee supporters and those from the Economic Freedom Party (EFP), hurled stones at each other.
Three people were shot dead and two others injured during an attack at Bendera village in Baragoi town, Samburu County. An unknown number of cattle were also stolen and driven towards Suguta valley
Al Shabaab kill two civilians while attacking civilians in the Mararani area.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Early AM, IVO Dhobley, Lower Jubba: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) elements and Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) soldiers killed an al Shabaab leader allegedly behind some of the attacks recently recorded along the Kenyan border. The leader, Hassan Issaq Ibrahim 'Beila', is the alleged ring leader of the al Shabaab cell responsible for several improvised explosive device (IED) attacks against Kenyan forces between Liboi and Dhobley. Two body guards were also killed.
After a violent cattle raid, polie clash with the raiders and recapture the stolen livestock

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Police repulse an attack by Al Shabaab on Mokowe GSU camp.
Al Shabaab kidnapped a NGO worker in Badhaadhe.

A powerful explosion caused by a land mine, occurred in parts of NFD [Northern Frontier District, Kenya'snortheastern region], targeting Kenyan military forces and resulting in casualties in an area called Abdi Ali in Liboi town.

Five security officers were killed during an operation to rescue a principal secretary in the ministry of lands and physical planning. A battle between the security personnel and Al Shabaab fighters left five security officers dead
Three people were killed and several were injured including Public Works Principal Secretary Mariam El Maawy, during an ambush by Al Shabaab attack in Lamu West.
Al Shabaab ground attack and shell KDF base of El Ram, causality unknown.
The police have launched air strikes in Boni Forest to attack Al Shabaab fighters
Meru inhabitants stabbed 3 Isiolo inhabitants to death at Kiutine market as part of the ongoing Meru-Isiolo border conflict.
09 July, evening, Belet Xaawo, Gedo: unidentified gunmen assassinated an official of a local women's association, reasons not known.
tags: women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders

notes: At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo villages near the border with Somalia. At Jima, Al Shabaab beheaded four men (coded in other event).
Four men have been beheaded by Al Shabaab at Jima area bordering Pandanguo in Lamu county. Kenya Standard reports 9 people were beheaded and the event took place on the previous day.
Movement of forces: On 5 July, the government deployed troops to Lamu to look for al-Shabab who have been attacking civilians and police officers in the county.

At least three police officers and one Al shabaab member were killed after Al Shabaab raided Pandanguo Police Camp in Lamu. Al Shabaab engaged in a gun battle with the police that lasted for hours. One police officer was unaccounted for. Al Shabaab planted IEDs while raiding the station. Government troops were later deployed to Lamu to look for al-Shabab. The Kenya Standard claims 2 police dead in the attack.

Unknown war planes conducted an airstrike targeting suspected al Shabaab positions at Wade grazing area (c. 10 km East of Badhaadhe town). Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
Hundreds of supporters of Governor Nathif Jama on Tuesday poured to the streets over reports that his Sh5.2 billion bank account has been frozen.

Herders in Bambo, Mandera, have discovered five bodies buried in a shallow grave.The five, four men and a woman, were reported missing by their relatives last week.The locals exhumed the bodies on Monday [3 July] morning and took them to Lafey Hospital.Medical personnel at the hospital told Nation.co.ke that a male body had bullet wounds in the forehead and the other bodies appeared to have been strangled.The five were from Fino Ward but their bodies were found in Warankara Ward about 65 kilometres away.

Herders in Bambo, Mandera, have discovered five bodies buried in a shallow grave.The locals exhumed the bodies on Monday [3 July] morning and took them to Lafey Hospital.Medical personnel at the hospital told Nation.co.ke that a male body had bullet wounds in the forehead and the other bodies appeared to have been strangled.The five were from Fino Ward but their bodies were found in Warankara Ward about 65 kilometres away.
The Kenyan security forces rescued 2 of the 4 pupils kidnapped during the Al Shabaab attack on Kiunga two days previously. No reports of clashes.
A second IED attack occurred at Ceel Waaq on 27/06. Details limited. The first occurred earlier in the day.

Eight people including four school children and four police officers were killed in a roadside bomb attack planted by suspected Al Shabaab fighters that occurred in Kiunga, Lamu on Tuesday. The police officers were escorting the school children to Kiunga from Mararani, when the lorry was hit by an IED. Following the blast, al Shabaab opened fire on the victims.

A Kenyan military convoy is hit by a roadside IED at Weray village, 18km east of Ceel Waaq town. Reports say that the Kenyan soldiers briefly clashed with al-Shabab fighters after the blast. Four deaths reported.
KDF convoy headed to Wajir hit by IED, damages reported, 2 KDF wounded.

The county commander said several people have been arrested in connection with an attack on a lorry carrying camels along Laisamis Road. One person was killed. The attackers transferred the animals to another truck and drove off.

A 12 year old boy was beheaded by raiders on Sunday morning in Saku constituency. Another person was seriously injured during the attack. The attack is suspected to be linked to recent violence between the Rendille and Borana communities.
Al Shabaab shot and killed a senior army officer in Ceel Waaq. No group claimed responsibility at the time of reporting.
An Improvised Device (IED) exploded when a vehicle ran over it. The vehicle was heading to Mandera from Elwak. No one was injured in the attack.
Five people were killed when Al Shabaab attacked the Equity bank In Elwak Town.
Police officers exchanged fire with Al Shabaab after they attacked the Equity Back in Elwak Town. Five police reported dead.

Students from Kirimon Primary School in Samburu West Sub County attacked and injured three female teachers in protest against being punished by female teachers. The school was closed after the attack.

Students from Kirimon Primary School in Samburu West Sub County attacked and injured three female teachers in protest against being punished by female teachers. The school was closed after the attack. Police are injured when they try to rescue the besieged teachers.

Two Kenya Defence Force (KDF) soldiers have been confirmed dead in an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) attack. The attack occurred on Monday, June 19, at Walcadey area near El Wak in Somalia's Gedo region. Al Shabaab was blamed.
Nine Kenyan soldiers were killed, and ten others were injured when a road side bomb explosed. Al Shabaab confirmed claimed responsibility of the attack.
Four cilivilians killed and 11 injured when a passenger bus struck a roadside bomb suspected to have been planted by Al Shabaab between Lafey and Elwak in Madera county.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland base in Damase village (c. 90 km North East of Ceelwaaq district). There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Somalia); Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022)
notes: Jubaland local police officers, manning a relief cash voucher distribution site, shot and injured an off-duty Somali soldier at an INGO office in Bosnia neighbourhood of Dhobley town. The soldier defied instruction of the local police and forcefully attempted to access the INGO office. The victim was rushed to hospital for medical treatment. The perpetrator was arrest.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a probing attack against AMISOM forces at Taabta (c. 60 km East of Dhobley town). AS fighters used small arms fire and several rounds of RPGs after which they retreated from the scene. There were no reports of casualties.
Detonation: The IED planted by Al Shabaab, and targeting Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) along the Milimani-Baure's supply route detonated without any casualties or injuries on the side of KDF.
A KDF convoy was transporting military supplies to Somalia when it was targeted in a massive roadside explosion, just outside of Liboi town. Several soldiers wounded.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM base, KIA unknown.

Raiders from Isiolo attacked an Administration Police (AP) camp at Mlango, about 30 kilometres from Isiolo Town. At the same time, five people were shot dead during a battle between police and armed communal militia at Mlango in Burat Ward, Isiolo County, who had stolen cattle. The militiamen were believed to be from Isolio and Samburu counties.

At least three people were killed after a car they were travelling in hit a landmine along Dadaab-Kulan road in Garissa County [eastern Kenya]. Al Shabaab believed responsible. One person escaped with injuries. The Star reports four dead.

Unknown gunmen shot dead one person and injured another in Mandera country near the Somalia border. The attackers targeted the vehicle belonging to a local political aspirant Mohamed Abdi who was not in the convoy of the two cars headed to El Wak town.

Unknown warplanes conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab bases located at Weel - Burad grazing area (c. 27 km South East of Dhobley). Heavy explosion sounds and engines revving were heard from South East of Dhobley town. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting due to lack of communication around the area.
On Monday, a team of security officers escaped an IED explosion unhurt as they hunted down a group of al-Shabab militants who had planted landmines in Gerille area, Wajir County.

Unknown war planes (sources suspect the US was responsible for an airstrike at nearby Weel Maro the following day) conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab locations at Bilbil and Galbse nomadic settlements area (c. 65 km South East of Dhobley). An unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters were killed and injured as the result of the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Jubaland forces kill a civilian driver in Dhobley, motive not known.

02 June, 23:30EAT, Kolbiyow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab briefly captured Kolbiyow from government forces following mortar shelling. Al-Shabab said it killed 10 Somali and Kenyan soldiers in the raid, however, Kenyan military forces claimed 14 al Shabaab dead. (This may have been the total from the retaliatory mission later in the day) Kenyan air and Somali land forces later forced withdrawal the same day.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: 02 June, 23:30EAT, Kolbiyow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab briefly captured Kolbiyow from government forces following mortar shelling. Al-Shabab said it killed 10 Somali and Kenyan soldiers in the raid, however, Kenyan military forces claimed 14 al Shabaab dead. (This may have been the total from the retaliatory mission later in the day) Kenyan air and Somali land forces later forced withdrawal the same day.
Al-Shabaab militants burned down a school and abducted two teachers in an overnight attack in Fafi, Garissa. One teacher is killed.

Two soldiers from Kenya Defence forces were killed, and another wounded in an IED explosion. Al-Shabaab claimed responibility of the attack. Another IED exploded in the same area on the same day before a Kenyan vehicle passed, leaving the passengers unharmed.
Seven police officers and a civilian were killed when an armoured vehicle drove over a roadside bomb in southeastern Kenya. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility
An explosive device aimed at a military lorry went off between Kiunga and Ishakani. It exploded early and there were no casualties.
Two motorists were shot and severely injured during a demonstration against police officers in Moyale town.
Three rangers were shot dead and five others seriously injured by Moran local fighters on Sunday

Herders from Isiolo and Marsabit are feared dead as they engaged each other in a deadly gun battle throughout Friday. Residents from the two sides said the herders exchanged fire that led to deaths estimated to be over 10 people. Both sides had casualties, but the Isiolo side reportedly lost more men.
Three Al-Shabaab militants shot dead a Tana River County Assembly driver on Friday

At last five police officers were killed and one other injured after an Improvised Explosive Devise tore their vehicle along the Malelei-Kulan Road in Liboi, Garissa County. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks
On 24 May 2017, two police officers were killed in an explosion between Malelei and Kulan in Garissa, near Hagadera refugee camp
At least three policemen were killed in an IED explosions in Liboi, Garissa County, near the Kenya - Somalia border. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks.

At least five policemen were killed in an IED explosions in Mandera, near the Kenya - Somalia border. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks. Police later arrested several Al-Shabaab suspects behind the attacks in Mandera county. One of the susptect is a high ranking Al-Shabaab explosives expert
3 rangers were killed in a battle with Moran cattle raiders in Archers Post.

assoc_actor_1: Jubilee Party; PDR: Party of Development and Reforms
notes: Supporters of Isiolo Governor Godana Doyo (Party for Development and Reforms - PDR), Senator Mohammed Kuti (Independent) and Abdul Bahari (Jubilee) hurled stones at each other ahead of President Uhuru Kenyatta's political rally. A Jubilee supporter was shot dead by the police when a Jubilee rally in Isiolo turned violent.

On 19 May 2017, suspected al Shabaab elements tossed a HG at the residence of a local authority official in Belet-Hawa. There were no casualties from the attack. Police patrolling the area carried out a cordon-and-search operation and arrested two suspects, who later confessed of being the perpetrators.

A Kenyan official was killed on Wednesday after a vehicle he was traveling in ran over an improvised explosive device in Elwak area near Kenya-Somalia border. Mandera East divisional police commander Timothy Muasya said the explosive device was buried on the ground by unknown people. The driver survived with serious injuries after the 1 p.m. incident. Police have blamed the attacks on Al-Shabaab militants who are operating in the area.
At least four people died on Tuesday when their vehicle set off an improvised explosive device in a small Kenyan town near the border with Somalia, police said.Al-Shabaab militants were suspected

A security operation is underway in Mandera town [northeastern Kenya] after a chief said to be instrumental in the war against terror was gunned down by people believed to be al-Shabab militia. The heavily armed al-Shabab militants are said to have raided the home of the chief in Omar Jillo location, Lafey sub-county in Mandera East before killing him on the spot. The military and the police have teamed up in an operation to comb Mandera in search of the assailants
Property destruction: Al Shabaab militants destroyed a communications mast in Wajir
Suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a village in Mandera and killed a chief before abducting two police reservists on Monday night.

Heavily-armed al-Shabab mujahideen movement forces have launched a major attack on a village on the outskirts of the city of Garissa [northeast Kenya].Reports from the Somali-dominated NFD [Northern Frontier Districts] of Kenya say the attack caused heavy casualties.Kenyan government officials have not officially commented on the death toll from the attack. Sources say al-Shabab forces seized control of the village, known as Amuma, with Kenyan police officials also confirming the attack to the media.
Two quarry workers were shot dead Friday and one was missing in a suspected extremist attack in Kenya's northern county of Mandera, a government official said.

12 May, evening, Likoley, Gedo: unverified reports suggested a senior al Shabaab leader (Abdullahi Bahar Ali Shira) had been shot dead in an internal struggle. Reasons of the shooting vary: Either executed on grounds of treason for talking to the Somali government or shot by accidental discharge of a firearm.
Kenya air forces strike al Shabaab locations at Ceeq Waaq and Baardheere. Causality figures not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Following an attack on a Kenyan convoy the previous day, al Shabaab launched a follow-up attack in the same area. Causalities reported, numbers not known. Al Shabaab was able to gain control of five Kenyan vehicles.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: 10 May, c. 1830 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jubaland and AMISOM re-supply convoy at Dad Qumbi (c. 05 km North West of Hosingo town). The convoy was stuck in mud while on transit in Hosingo when they were ambushed by AS. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. A Jubaland soldier succumbed to his injuries and five AMISOM soldiers were injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al-Shabaab has carried out a large-scale attack on a Kenya defence forces convoy in Hosingow area of Lower Jubba region. After the attack on the convoy, heavy exchange of gunfire ensued causing causalities on both sides. Causality numbers not known. There was a follow-up attack the following day.

Al Shabaab militants raided Omar Jilo, in northern Kenya, where they clashed with police forces. 2 local administrators were killed and 2 police reservists were abducted. Security personnel are pursuing the attackers.

Further reports have emerged of the damage caused by an explosion that targeted a Kenyan army convoy in Garissa County, northeastern Kenya. The explosion which was a land mine attack was targeted on a Kenya army convoy in between Liboi town and Kulan village in Garissa county. Kenyan police said the explosion injured several soldiers with three sustaining serious injuries. The injured were airlifted to a hospital in the capital, Nairobi, for treatment. No one who has claimed responsibility for the attack given that al-Shabab has severally taken credit for attacks that have happened in northeastern Kenya.

A boda boda rider has died Tuesday morning after a collision with a KDF truck in Isiolo Town.There was tension as angry locals threatened to set a blaze the truck.They were also threatening to lynch the driver of the lorry.Police officers had to shoot in the air to disperse the crowd and allow them to collect the body of the boda boda rider.Two other people were seriously injured in the crash and were rushed to the Isiolo County Referral Hospital.

At least six Kenyan security officers were injured in a bomb blast on Monday in the northeast region of Garissa near the Somali border. Somali militant group Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack, saying its fighters killed four government soldiers, including two commanders.
Presiding officers and clerks hired by Jubilee Party during the Nakuru County nominations on Friday staged a demonstration to demand for their pay at the party regional headquarters in Milimani.
Al Shabaab militants attacked El Wak town. 2 people were killed.
Agreement: An unnamed al Shabaab commander reportedly defected from al Shabaab and surrendered to government base in Damase village (approx. 40kms E of Ceel Waaq district).
Early AM, IVO Ceel Waaq, Gedo: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) fighter jets struck suspected al Shabaab positions. Resulting causalities not known.
KDF warplane conducted airstrike at Bududha grazing area (approx. 20 km E of Ceel Waaq town). Report indicate that the area was an al Shabaab hideout. Resulting causality figures not known.

Residents of South Horr protested against the cancellation of the nominations in the Jubilee Coalition primary elections on 28/04/2017. They sat on the border of Samburu and Marsabit counties questioning why the nominations are held in the neighbouring Samburu and all other wards in Marsabit county but not in South Horr. No fatalities. The source does not indicate the exact time of the event.
Anti-riot police disperse angry voters at Hola who were prevented from voting by the agents of a gubernatorial aspirant

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Kenyan AMISOM forces attack and overrun a al Shabaab camp at Badhaadhe with artillery fire and ground forces. 52 al Shabaab reported dead.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Initial reports stated that KDF conducted an airstrike targeting al Shabaab training camp at Qabaa (c. 30 km East of Hosingo). An unconfirmed number of AS fighters were reported killed and the airstrike caused major destruction of the camp. It was confirmed that there was an AS training camp at the targeted location. AS fighters restricted access of the location to locals.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 16th April, afternoon, IVO Hosingow, Lower Jubba: a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) placed by al Shabaab. Jubaland forces were also present. The attack was followed by an exchange of gunfire that lasted 40 minutes. Al Shabaab claimed 15 dead, though AMISOM/Jubaland forces claimed four.

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against KDF base at Buusaar village (c. 40 km East of Ceel Waaq). Al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the area. There were no reports of casualties.
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
Non-violent activity: 10 April, 23:00EAT, Mandera, Kenya: al Shabaab militants entered Mandera and hijacked two pick-up trucks.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
notes: A Jubaland soldier kills a taxi driver, reasons not known. The killing was likely intentional, as the solder was later executed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: A Shabaab attacked two Kenya Defence Force (KDF) military bases in Hosingow and Koday. Causalities not articulated. Two al Shabaab reported dead in Koday, including a commander.
Angry and rowdy youth chanting anti-Jubilee slogans disrupted the president's rally in Wajir and engaged the police. The police dispersed the rioters.
SNAF forces ambushed an al Shabaab vehicle in the morning hours, three al Shabaab reported dead. Al Shabaab later attacked a SNAF checkpoint at 1900hrs. No fatalities.
Movement of forces: Suspected Al-Shabaab hijacked a Kenyan government vehicle in the border town of Elwak in Mandera country. The attackers released the driver and reportedly drove into Somalia.
Two unidentified neighbouring communities clash in Garissa, along its border with Wajir over a boundary dispute. One bystander was reportedly killed in the clash. Date not clear - source dated 28/03.

Attackers believed to be from the Bahgere clan from Wajir South attacked Fadiwein village, which is inhabited by Auliyan community, injuring one. Eleven houses were also burnt and the attackers made away with 300 goats and five camels. The two communities had been fighting over a disputed boundary with the Bahgere, claiming the area falls under Wajir South, while Auliyan says it is in Garissa county.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: KDF launched air & ground raid against al Shabaab in Hola Wajer & Siraare, 31 al Shabaab dead between the two towns.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: KDF launched air & ground raid against al Shabaab in Hola Wajer & Siraare, 31 al Shabaab dead between the two towns.

At least two children were killed and three others injured on 25/03 after explosion went off in a unnamed village in Mandera county. Authorities suspect al Shabaab, though no group has claimed responsibility.
Somali and Kenyan forces exchange fire near Ceel Waaq. The clash was believed to related to a border issue. No reported causalities.
Ten people were killed and four injured in a cattle raid in Marti, Samburu, on 22/03/2017. It is believed to be a retaliatory attack run by thieves of a neighbouring community.
Three are killed in a clash between Turkana and Samburu militias. The clash was sparked by revenge for cattle theft.
At least 10 people have been killed in Kom, Isiolo County between Borana and Samburu militias. The clash was spurred over drought.
Lawmakers in the Mandera County Assembly clash over disagreements of a bill. Political parties not known.

Non-violent activity: Armed al Shabaab men stormed into a local NGO office in Ceel- waq town. The staff members were not present at time of the incident but it was confirmed that al Shabaab harassed the security guard and fled with a rented vehicle that was parked in the compound.

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'
The KDF engaged Al Shabaab fighters at Kolbio.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: KDF convoy hit by an al Shabaab roadside IED, causalities not known.

Auliyan militia attacked Duse centre in Isiolo County in a retaliatory attack following their expulsion for the area by government forces weeks prior. Five killed, six injured. Two of the attackers were shot and killed by police.

Auliyan militia attacked Duse centre in Isiolo County in a retaliatory attack following their expulsion for the area by government forces weeks prior. Five killed, six injured. Two of the attackers were shot and killed by police.
Auliyan militia attacked Garba Tula, killing a 70-year old man. The attack is believed to be related to revenge after being forces off land.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
assoc_actor_2: Oromo Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); Unidentified Armed Group (Ethiopia)
notes: A fight broke out between Oromiya region police officers and Liyu Police personnel when the latter attempted to build a house in front of the police station. State soldiers quickly intervened, seperating the two. Casualties are unknown at this time.
Al-Shabaab fighters have attacked a Kenyan military convoy at Lamu. Al Shabaab claimed killing four. Kenya acknowledged the attack, but said only one was killed.
Protest in the Rhamu over a proposed county budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM KDF and SNA on security patrol at Elbeet, nomadic settlement area approx. 15km N of Husungo village and approx. 65km S of Dhobley. Reportedly there was an exchange of gunfire for about 15 minutes resulting in on injured KDF officer. Al Shabaab escaped from the scene and their casualties' remain unknown. The injured KDF officer was taken to Hosungo AMISOM KDF comp for treatment.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: On 3 March 2017, al Shabaab elements ambushed AMISOM and SNAF troops on patrol at Elbeet (ca.65km south of Dhobley). One Kenyan soldier was reported injured in the exchange of gunfire.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped three teachers from Dadaab camp. Al Shabaab have carried out abductions in the past, though it is not clear who the perpetrators were in this instance.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters tossed a HG into the residence of a local clan elder in Belet-Hawa on 2 March. The elder and three other persons were injured in the attack. Three men were arrested in relation to the incident.
Boda boda riders in Maralal Town held demonstrations over alleged misappropriation of funds meant for construction of shades.
Three are attacked and killed with blunt objects in Garissa on the night of 22/02. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: An AMISOM-KDF convoy is hit by a al Shabaab land mind while travelling at Hawina, near Dhobley. Al Shabaab claims 14 dead.

Four armed AS fighters using AK47s, who are believed to have fired bullets at a Toyota Land Cruiser transporting khat at approximately 06 km from the Kenya-Somali border were observed at Lagta area (c. 09 km North of Dhobley town). Casualties not known.
An al Shabaab IED targets and kills a soldier in Ceel Waaq.

Three SNA soldiers erected an illegal check point at an AS controlled location called Ausqurun 80km S of Elwak. All three soldiers were reported to have been under the influence of drugs. AS attacked them, killing one on the spot. The other two escaped, but one of them later died of injuries after arriving at Elwak.
On 8 February 2017, Samburu residents protested against Raila Odinga, burning posters and lighting bonfires.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: AMISOM KDF troops from Tabto base, while on a security operation, clashed with AS fighters at Jaldeso area (c. 40 km North of Dhobley) on the main Afmadow/Dhobley road. There was an exchange of small arms fire after which AS fighters managed to escape. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: AMISOM forces clashed with al Shabaab elements at Jaldeso area, 40 km N of Dhobley. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab ambushed KDF combat patrol 30km west of Buusaar, no causalities reported.

A roadside bomb ripped through a military convoy carrying Kenyan defence forces (KDF) near the border town of El Wak at Boc-bosa village. The attack led to a gun battle between the two actors. Number of casualties not reported.

100+ gunmen believed to be al-Shabaab attacked a police post and destroyed communication masts in Arabia area, Mandera County. At least one bystander died in the attack. Number of other casualties not known, as al Shabaab had destroyed communication masts in the area. Shabelle Media Network reports an 'unknown number of police officers were killed.'

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: KDF conducted air strikes on an al Shabaab base at Showla Mareer, near Hosingow. Causalities unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
