notes: Al Shabaab launch a large attack on a KDF base at Kulbiyow. The attackers managed to overtake that base, killing between 51 and 57 soldiers. Military equipment was also reported captured. Despite the majority of reported describing the above, a Lt. Col in the Public Relation's office denied the military and lost control of the base via Twitter. Witnesses put the fatalities at around 40.

Ethiopian soldiers entered a bus in the town of Moyale in Borena zone and accused several aboard of having contraband from Kenya. Those accused refused to get off the bus and the soldiers opened fire, killing 4 and wounding 8 others aboard. Those injured were taken to the hospital in Moyale.
Youth in Isiolo Town protest over what they termed as delays in the vetting process for issuing national identification cards.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: Kenya forces retake Badhaadhe from al Shabaab following an offensive. At least four al Shabaab and two civilians were killed. The Americans were also involved in the operation. The conquering forces left the town six hours later, allowing for al Shabaab to return.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: Kenya forces retake Badhaadhe from al Shabaab following an offensive. At least four al Shabaab and two civilians were killed. The Americans were also involved in the operation. The conquering forces left the town six hours later, allowing for an al Shabaab return.
A Kenya Police Reservist (KPR) was killed after suspected Al-Shabaab perpetrators hurled explosives at a bank and two hotels in Mandera town on the morning of 23/01.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF convoy at Samarole. casualties not reported.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Ethiopia)
notes: Somali and Kenyan defence forces have driven out al Shabaab from Nus Dariiq, as well as 'nearby villages which are situated between the towns of Beled Hawo and El Wak.' At least five soldiers reported dead.
An RCIED exploded at an animal market, causing injury to a member of the staff. Perpetrators not known.
Al Shabaab forces bomb [government soldiers] at a khat establishment, killing one solder. The forces in the bar opened fire following the blast.
KDF conducted air strikes on an al Shabaab base at Nusdarrig, near Ceel Waaq. casualty not known.
An al Shabaab roadside blast and ambush against Kenyan forces near Nus Dariiq causes five deaths.

Reports indicate that al Shabaab ambushed KDF troops at Warey location approx. 25 km East of Cel waq town. The KDF convoy was travelling from El-wak Kenya to Busar village. After an exchange of gunfire AS withdrew and KDF continued their journey to Busar village. No casualties reported.

Nine al-Shabaab fighters and a government soldier were killed when government forces backed Kenyan army attacked an al-Shabaab-held town of Buusaar. Reports say the Somali army took control of Buusaar after al-Shabaab withdrew.
At least two people were killed and some others injured by suspected al-Shabaab who vandalized a communication mast in the Tarbaj area near the border with Somalia.

Three armed men clad in SNA uniform (not clear if legitimate soldiers), demanded money from a UN food truck, which was being off-loaded by contractors at a warehouse in Ceel Waaq on 21/12. The contracted company refused to pay as they had been cleared before by the local administration. The armed men opened fire at the lorry, damaging some of the food items. Ceel Waaq local authorities intervened immediately and the three men were arrested.
Military forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Hulugho during the mid-morning of 15/12.
Al Shabaab claims they have gained control of Ceel Waaq following a overnight raid wounding four soldiers. The forces left the following morning, SNG retook the town without violence.

Suspected Al-Shabaab have attacked Dabacity in Elwak, Mandera County and destroyed a Safaricom telecommunication mast. County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said the attack occurred at about 1.45am on 12/12.The attackers overpowered five security operatives guarding the mast, causing them to flee.
Al Shabaab claims they have gained control of Ceel Waaq following a overnight raid wounding four soldiers. The forces left the following morning, SNG retook the town without violence.
A military patrol encounters and kill four suspected members of al Shabaab in the Hulugho area on 09/12.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: At least four Kenyan defence force soldiers were killed, several injured in a bomb attack on KDF military convoy in southern Somalia on 07/12. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: AS fighters ambushed an AMISOM/KDF convoy heading from Afmadow to Dhobley at Hawina grazing area (94km SW of Afmadow). The ambush which reportedly started with an IED explosion damaged one of the convoy's trucks. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the AS fighters withdrew. The resulting casualties are unknown.

Three people are injured in Mandera after their fuel tanker ran over an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) between Kotulo and Chuma Mrefu. Al Shabaab suspected. A similar attack against police occurred earlier in the week.
Suspected al Shabaab target police with an IED in Mandera. No causalities.
Traders protest forced eviction in Isiolo.

Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of students sitting for examination in Wajir. The gunmen later exchanged fire with police with were guarding the institution. Motive not known. No reported deaths.
Al Shabaab attacked Haluqa, outside of Garissa, targeting a Safaricom building. The attackers abducted several workers and took them into Somalia.

Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of students sitting for examination in Wajir. The gunmen later exchanged fire with police with were guarding the institution. Motive not known. No reported deaths.
Four Al-Shabaab members were killed in El-Wak, Mandera County after a combined team of security officers thwarted a planned terror attack against specific high value targets including police camps.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: JSF attacked an al Shabaab base in Bura, 65km south-west of Dhobley. One JSF, six al Shabaab reported killed.
Movement of forces: Al Shabaab enters two villages in Ijara sub-county, forcing residents to hear a lecture in their local mosque.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked a JSF/AMISOM base located at Hoosingo. Following 30 minutes of small arms fire, al Shabaab retreated. No reports of causalities.
Six people died and two others were injured in fighting between Jibril and Matan clans in Wajir county [in northeast Kenya] on Saturday.
Four killed and a dozen wounded in an IED attack on a Kenyan convoy in Busaar. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab gunmen detonated explosives at Boshari Guesthouse during the early morning hours. Twelve killed, others injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility, saying the targets of their attacks were Christians. Police later imposed a dusk till dawn curfew.
A night guard was on Monday night killed by a stray bullet during a shootout between police and suspected al Shabaab gunmen in Mandera. One death reported.
Clashes between unidentified armed group and soldiers in Golole village, near Hidilola in Borena zone, leaving at least several soldiers injured.
Police use tear gas to disperse an ongoing contactors protest when they had become 'rowdy.'
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Isiolo County staff protest a work stoppage.
On 9 October 2016, a man was attacked by a police officer in Baragoi, Sumburu. He had been pelted with stones.
A cross-border al Shabaab attack kills six in Mandera. The attackers targeted 'non-locals' and/or 'Christians.'
Residents protest a water shortage in Garissa.
Al Shabaab, numbering 50, attacks a police station in Liboi. One of the assailants was killed and several seriously injured during a gunbattle.
Al Shabaab attacks a police station in Hamey, near Garissa. The insurgents killed six officers and captured two others.
Kenyan forces launch a mortar barrage against al Shabaab positions in Dhamase, killing 'many people (likely civilian) and livestock.'
Kenyan air forces conducted air strikes on Damase village, near Ceel Waaq. No causalities reported.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Ethiopia)
notes: Somali and AMISOM regain control of Ceel Waaq after al Shabaab flees.
Al Shabaab attacks Ceel Waaq, twelve dead in the ensuing clash. Al Shabaab gained control of town.
Residents protest recent banditry in their area.

At least four more people have been killed in raging armed conflict between Borana and Somali herders (Auliyan) along the Isiolo-Garissa border [northeastern Kenya]. The fighting took place in Tana village about 11km north of Garba-Tula town on Saturday [10 September].
An RCIED exploded at a police post. No reports of causalities.

Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for double roadside explosions targeted Kenyan defence forces near the town of Mandera on 09/09. Pro-al shabaab media outlets, citing unnamed commander reported that at least 4 Kenyan army soldiers died in the IED blasts on the KDF military convoy.
A Borana man is attacked and killed by Somali herders in Garfasa, Isiolo County. The attack is believed to be retaliatory.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Reports form Beled Hawo town in Gedo region in Somalia indicate that at least four people have been confirmed dead and eight wounded in the fighting between residents and soldiers loyal to Jubaland. Fighting broke out when Jubaland soldiers attacked a house meeting by militia who were preparing to carry out attacks against Jubaland.

Unidentified assailants target a local market with an IED over formation of a local authority. Two dead, four injured. Following the attack police clash with the suspected assailants injuring one officer.

Unidentified assailants target a local market with an IED over formation of a local authority. Two dead, four injured. Following the attack police clash with the suspected assailants injuring one officer.
Two RCIED attacks against civilian areas in Bula Hawa. Three killed, others injured.

A Muslim cleric died on Saturday evening after his vehicle hit an improvised explosive device (IED) in the Kenyan coastal county of Lamu, near the border with Somalia. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators.
Unidentified armed groups battled in Moyale, Borena zone.
Police clash with market traders in Isiolo. Three injured, including a police officer.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Ethiopia)
notes: Somali National Army (SNA) backed by Africa Union peacekeeping mission (AMISOM) on Monday captured four locations near Bardhere town: Matano, Anole, Tubako and Qutaley. Casualties not known.
One is dead following a fight between two rival communities Kuri, Isiolo County on 14/08.
People protested in Moyale, Borena, as part of a grand protest by Oromo people against the government agenda that took place across more than 200 cities and towns in Oromia.
Four police officers were injured during an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab militants who tried to force their way into the Basuba General Service Unit (GSU) camp in Lamu East on Saturday evening.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab attacked a Jubaland forces base in Hoosingo, no report of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab attacks JSF in Dif village, causing the 30 minute clash. Al Shabaab took control of the village. No reports of casualties.
Suspected al Shabaab detonate an explosive at a police building injuring one officer.
Two civilians are shot and injured by suspected al Shabaab elements near a local mosque.

Clashes between Ethiopian forces and OLF soldiers in Malabi village, Moyale district, Borena Zone, killed two Ethiopian soldiers and wounded another four. Ethiopian soldiers allegedly fired on civilians in retaliation, wounding several people.

Clashes between Ethiopian forces and OLF soldiers in Malabi village, Moyale district, Borena Zone, killed two Ethiopian soldiers and wounded another four. Ethiopian soldiers allegedly fired on civilians in retaliation, wounding several people.

OLA forces attacked a government forces in four villages in Moyale district, killing nearly 22 soldiers, injuring several others, and capturing armaments: two soldiers were killed in an attack on a military base in Malab; another two were killed in Dhadacha Chame; heavy casualties were reported in Mansa Badole; and eight were killed and 12 injured in Gara Gadamsa.

A Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) convoy was ambushed after their vehicle overran an explosive in Fino Town, Mandera County. Between 6 and 10 causalities. Elsewhere in Fino on the same date Al Shabaab destroys a communication mast in Fino and engage police in a gunfight. Four injuries.
People protested against the government agenda in Hidilola, Miyo District, Borena Zone.
A KDF convoy runs over a al Shabaab-planted landmine in Ishakani, five injured.

Kenyan military fired mortar rounds on Dhamase in Gedo region of southwestern Somalia which is under the control of Al Shabaab fighters. Scores of civilians and livestock were killed in the barrage. Al Shabaab dead not known.

Two Kenyan soldiers and one Somali soldier were killed Friday when al-Shabab militants ambushed their convoy in Ceel Waaq District. Regional military officials said the ambush began with a massive roadside explosion which destroyed a Kenyan military vehicle, killing the two Kenyan soldiers and wounding others. Al-Shabaab fighters then fired on the convoy and exchanged heavy gunfire with Kenyan and Somali National Army soldiers. Officials said at least three militants were killed in the fighting. Later, Somali Memo reported 11 KDF dead.
An al-Shabaab suspect was killed in Kenyas coastal town of Lamu in a foiled dawn attack at a local police station. One officer was injured.

Defusal: Military forces foil an ambush on a convoy in Lamu by identifying IEDs and detonating them. No injuries. The security forces are reportedly in pursuit of the suspected attackers in the area. The planned attack and subsequent security sweep took place on 12/07.
Police officers, on their way to Lamu, escaped death by a whisker after al Shabaab militia men attempted to attack their vehicle which was heading to Mokowe in Lamu County on Sunday.

Non-violent activity: An al Shabaab militant was reportedly caught planting an EID on Belet-Xaawa main road during the night. The incident was reported to Dollow LA which instructed SNA in Belet-Xaawa to get hold of the perpetrator. Later on SNA from Dollow was dispatched to Belet-hawa to take over the perpetrator and bring him to Dollow. The person is currently under custody of Dollow SNA. According to information the perpetrator has given more information concerning some civilians in Belet-Xaawa who pretend to be businessmen but are involved in al Shabelle activities.
A woman was killed while three others were critically injured when suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen attacked a vehicle between Fino and Lafey at around 7pm on Saturday night.

More than 100 Al Shabaab raided Diff Police station in Wajir on early Saturday morning, stealing firearms and bullets. They left one police officer wounded, and are believed to have escaped with serious injuries during an exchange of fire with officers during the 1 am incident. Al Shabaab gained control of the town after several hours of fighting. The Somali Memo reports causalities without number.

Al Shabaab hijacked two vehicles carrying khat near Dhobley after opening fire on the drivers. The fate of the vehicles and passengers remain unknown after Al Shabaab took them to undisclosed location in Lower Jubba region
People protested against the government agenda in Hidilola, Borena, after Eid Celebrations.
An explosive near a water well in Dhabaa, near Dhamase, targets Kenyan forces. One area resident was killed and two others were wounded in the blasts. Al Shabaab are suspected as perpetrators.

Unidentified armed men with AK 47 rifles attacked and injured two male civilians who were traveling with a lorry fetching Water from Degelema heading to Barkinta village (approx. 35km S of Dhobley ) at the Border line between Kenya and Somalia. Victims were reportedly taken to Kenya for further medical treatment. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive is unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed an AMISOM (KDF Contingent) convoy heading to Kulbiyow at Ali Wali area (approx. 8kms SW of Kulbiyo, the borderline between Kenya and Somali). The convoy was reportedly heading to Kulbiyo village. An explosion initiated the ambush followed by an armed clash between the two sides. One KDF military truck was reportedly damaged by the explosion. Casualties from the incident are unknown.

Six people were killed and scores injured when a bus plying the Mandera-Nairobi route was sprayed with bullets by heavily armed assailants between Wargadud and Elwak. Government sources believe the assailants may have been a local militia group, not al Shabaab, which was the initial suspicion.
Al Shabaab claims it has killed 6 KDF soldiers in an ambush attack on a base of Kenyan troops in Lamu Island near Somalia border. KDF denies either the attack took place or the causality figure.
Kenyan Air Forces carry out strikes on an al Shabaab position Belet Xaawo in response to an attack in Lamu, Kenya. The strikes killed 'militants and civilians.'
Kenyan forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Milimani and recover weapons.
Kenyan defence forces (KDF) have fired at least nine mortar rounds on a residential area in Gedo region near Somali border with Kenya on 26/06, killing one civilian.
Al Shabaab are reported to have struck Damasa border town and destroyed a Safaricom communication mast and a water pump using explosives. No reported human causality or violence.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed JLF at (Sarirah) area approx. 6km NW of Husungo. Reportedly the JLF were on their way back from a security patrol on the outskirts of the village during the attack. Two government soldiers were killed and seven others injured. AMISOM KDF troops also reached the scene right after the incident but the perpetrators had managed to escape from the area after the incident. The number of casualties on the al Shabaab side is unknown.
Kenyan forces repel an al Shabaab attack at Dhamase after hours of heavy fighting. Causalities not known.
While pursuing al Shabaab in Gedo region, Kenyan forces air forces strike Ilaale location, near Ceel Waaq, killing four children. No reported combatant dead.
At least 300 tuberculosis (TB) and HIV/Aids patients in Isiolo protested against plans to convert a regional TB isolation centre into county assembly offices.
One dead and three injured when an ambulance hit a suspected al-Shabaab planted land mine in Hulugho.
Five Kenyan policemen escorting a passenger bus have been killed after al-Shabaab fighters ambushed their convoy in El Wak on 20/06. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab forces attack Kenyan forces base in Hoosingow area. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against AMISOM KDF/JLF position at Hosungo village (approx. 90 km SE Dhobley). Reportedly al Shabaab fighters directed small arms fire towards the AMISOM/JLF position from a distance. The joint forces responded, and al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. No casualties reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: According to reports from locals at Albeet area approx. 17 km W of Husungo, al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM KDF convoy travelling from Dhobley to Hosungo at Albeet. There was a brief exchange of gun fire before al Shabaab retreated from the scene. No casualties reported.
Eight Kenyans have been kidnapped by the al-Shabab militants in the past month in the Alango and Kurokura (Mandera County) areas. Dates unknown, though the latest kidnapping took place on 10/07.
Students of Lamu Bujra Boys High School go on a violent protest after several other students were suspended over a disciplinary matter.

An IED detonated at Mandera, near the Somali border on 11/06. No causalities reported. The Mandera County Commissioner said the incident, which took place at Border Point Three area near custom offices, had targeted security officers manning the border area and was likely caused by al Shabaab.
On 11 June 2016, in Belet Xaawa, an IED planted at a check point manned by Kenyan police exploded. Later two other IEDs exploded in the same area. No causalities reported.
[Al Shabaab] forces carried out fierce attack on AMISOM-KDF bases in Busaar area of Gedo. Causalities not known.

SNA and KDF troops were attacked at Buusar village (c. 50 km East of Ceel Waaq District). It is believed that SNA and KDF defended the base after a confrontation with al Shabaab fighters that lasted for few minutes. There were no reports of causalities.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: A convoy transporting Kenyan defence forces (KDF) was targeted in a roadside bomb explosion outside Liboi town near Somali border on 03/06. The bomb blast has destroyed one of vehicles in the convoy, causing unidentified casualties. Al Shabaab are beloved responsible.

A convoy transporting Kenyan defence forces (KDF) was targeted in a roadside bomb explosion outside Liboi town near Somali border by suspected al Shabaab. The bomb blast has destroyed one of vehicles in the convoy, causing unidentified casualties as Kenyan military did not comment on the IED attack.

Students of St Pauls Kiwanjani Mixed Secondary School in Isiolo went on strike the morning of 31/05, destroying and stealing property. The students destroyed classroom window panes and looted electronics, computers, books and teachers laptops before police intervened. The violence was sparked after several students were suspended for drug use.

Movement of forces: Forty-five members of al Shabaab are witnessed crossing into Kenya at Sugrow, Wajir County. One group of 13 was sighted headed towards Gerille, another towards Konton and another towards Gumarey areas of Wajir East.

Local police officers clashed at Belethawa Police Station. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for almost ten minutes. The reason behind the clash was not clear. There were no reports of casualties.
At least 11 Al-Shabaab killed and two government soldiers wounded on 25/05 after fighting between the group and Somalia National Army (SNA) in El-Wak (Ceel Waaq) town in Gedo region.
Al Shabaab attacks a khat transport vehicle at Kamoor Waraabey location, near Belet Xaawo, killing the driver.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab forces ambushed a SNG and AMISOM-KDF convoy near Dhobley on 24/05, 25 al Shabaab killed, including a junior commander.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a Jubaland forces base in Hoosingo Village (97km NW of Badhaadhe Town) in the night of 18/05. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about ten minutes, after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported from both sides.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab forces attack, and briefly overtake Hosingow village from Kenyan and Jubaland forces. Causalities not known.

Non-violent activity: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a private residential house belonging to a senior SNGF commander in Belet Xaawo in the night of 15/05. It is not clear if the officer was in the home at the time of attack. SNG police later conducted a search operation. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Weapons Seizure: Jubaland forces recover a large cache of weapons from al Shabaab in Belet Xaawo region on 11/05, no reported violence.

Villagers found the decapitated body of a man hailing from Leysan sub-clan in Buulo Xaawo (60 KM SW of Baidoa) on 23/04. Reports indicate that he was accused by al Shabaab to work with and spy for ISWA, though the source does not further identify the possible perpetrator.

ISWA security forces went to Buulo Xaawo (60 KM SW of Baidoa) on security operation as result of the killing of a man in the morning on 22/04. After a brief armed clash, al Shabaab fighters abandoned the village and fled. Two al Shabaab affiliated women (unknown if they were combatants or simply loyal to al Shabaab) were shot and killed by ISWA forces as they were unable to flee.

An IED was planted on 21/04 near a bridge in Baardheere Town frequently used by ENDF vehicles. A Tuk-Tuk (food truck) drove over the device and exploded injuring the driver and two passengers, who were brought to Baardheere hospital for treatment. Perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported.
Unknown assailants throw and grenades against the home of a Somali lawmaker on 14/04, injuring four civilians.

'A contracted driver for a UN agency was abducted by suspected Al Shabaab fighters near Likoley and Elade, Gedo region in Somalia while carrying humanitarian supplies to a distribution site. The truck was looted. As a result of this incident, deliveries of humanitarian supplies have not resumed to those areas. The driver was released after one week.'

An IED targeted the District Commissioner's vehicle near GIIRGIIR Pharmacy in Belet Xaawo in the afternoon of 11/04. Reports indicate that the DC escaped unharmed but two of his security staff were injured. The device was most likely planted inside the vehicle. SNGF carried out security operations in the area where the explosion took place, but no arrests were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters attack a police station in Dif on 10/04, injuring three officers before escaping in the police vehicle.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab attacks and overtakes Dif village on 09/04, destroying property and recovering weapons. Causalities not known.

Residents of Ndoto Ward in Samburu North Sub County on 05/04 held protests at Lesirkan trading centre over the recent police recruitment exercise which they claimed was unfair and marred with corruption.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Fighting reportedly broke out between SNG military and Jubaland forces in Belet Xaawo Town in the afternoon of 03/04. At least two soldiers from the two sides were reportedly killed while three soldiers and two civilians were also injured.
Residents of Kirimon in Samburu Central Sub-County protest over what they say is illegal grabbing of 10,000 acres of public land meant to benefit their community.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab near Baadhaade. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: A KDF convoy was targeted with an IED in Gulshu, a farmland located between Kolbiyow and Raskambooni along the border (approx. 45km SW of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 17/03. Casualties are unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab ambushes a Kenyan convoy at Kolbiyow, destroying the vehicle and killing eight.
People protested against the government agenda in Hidilola as part of the third round of Oromo protests.

An armed clashed broke out between two groups of SNGF in Beled Xawo on the morning of 20/02. The fighting broke out after one group tried to stop the other from taking taxation from the market and public transports. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Belet Xawo in the morning of 16/02 following after two commanders disputed over the commanding of the police station. The DC arrived at the scene and managed to intervene between the two fighting forces. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
notes: Weapons Seizure: According to pro-al Shabaab media reports a drone reportedly operated by the United States crashed in Sandacaar (18km SE of Ceel Waaq) on 14/02. The drone was armed with six missiles which did not explode. Al Shabaab confiscated the drone and the missiles. No casualties were reported. The Pentagon denied the crash.

SNG forces based in Kamoor Village (25km NE of Belet Xaawo) vacated their base and moved back to Belet Xaawo on 10/02. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly have take over the control of the village. No reports of armed clash.

Al Shabaab fighters took control of Weel Cade Village (Approx. 135km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 07/02. Following the takeover the fighters reportedly ordered local residents to vacate some part of the village saying that its strategic point for the Mujahidin. Reports indicate that pro-Jubaland local clan militias manning a checkpoint at the village escaped before the al Shabaab arrival. Further reports in the morning of 08/02 indicate that the local population deserted the village.
Kenyan forces exit Khadijo Hagi village, al Shabaab quickly enters the village. No violence reported.
Security forces kill four members of al Shabaab and recover weapons in Boni Forest on 02/02.
Al Shabaab attacks Pandanguo village, targeting the homes of Christians. Al Shabaab claimed 'many' killed, though more reliable reports indicate three dead, plus injuries.
On 31 January 2016, more than 400 residents of Mpeketoni in Lamu County (Lamu West) protested over increased insecurity and frequent attacks by Al-Shabaab militants.

Gunmen reportedly hailing from Dhulbahante shot and killed a driver of a vehicle transporting khat in the outskirts of Hoosingo (97km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 27/01. The victim hail from Sheekhal clan and the incident was reportedly related to previous revenge killings.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: An IED hit a KDF convoy in Kolbiyow (33km SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 27/01. Initial reports indicate that one KDF was killed and nine others wounded while one APC was damaged. Helicopters from Kismaayo are said to have flown to the area to medevac the injured soldiers to Dhobley.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: AMISOM forces leave Baadhaade on 26/01; al Shabaab quickly fills the void.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: KDF helicopters bombed a grazing area approximately 20km NE of Hoosingow (Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 26/01. The area is inhabited by pastoralists and casualties are unknown. The specific target of the KDF is not known.
Six police (or seven - Shabelle Media Network) officers are killed when their vehicle struck an IED in Lamu, suspected al Shabaab responsible.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF convoy near Likooley (95km SW of Belet Xawo) on 26/01. The ambush reportedly started with an IED explosion before the attackers moved in. No reported casualties.

Three people were killed while another one was seriously injured after morans from two communities clashed over land in Leparua on the Isiolo-Laikipia border. The identity of the actors are not known.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Suspected al Shabaab fighters raided a private house in Alwileh, Beled Xawo District (approx. 25km NW of Ceel Cadde), killing the owner of the house and allegedly four KDF soldiers who seek sanctuary in the house after the Ceel Cadde attack on 17/01. No other casualties were reported.

An IED targeted a KDF convoy passing in Likooley Village (96km SW of Beled Xawo) in the afternoon of 16/01. One vehicle was reportedly destroyed while villagers also reported the sound of heavy gun-fire. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab attacked a group of Kenyan forces in Dhamase. Casualties of death and military equipment were reported on the Kenyan forces, specific numbers not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attacked against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Kolbiyow Village (38km SW of Badhaadhe) in the evening of 13/01.The clash lasted for about 15 minutes and both sides used light weapons before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Badhaadhe town on 09/01.The sides briefly clashed for about 10 minutes after the attackers withdrew. The Kenya Daily reported the SNG forces reported with gunfire, killing 19 of the attackers.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a house in Beled Xawo where SNG police were staying on 06/01. Causalities, injuries no reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: A RCIED targeted AMISOM/KDF convoy heading to Afmadow on its way from Dhoobley in Hawina (approx. 90km SW of Afmadow) in the morning of 04/01. One vehicle was damaged and three KDF soldiers were injured.

Suspected al Shabaab ambushed a police convoy in Lamu on the afternoon of 01/01, injuring security officials and setting a police truck on fire. There was a fierce gun battle at the scene preceded by an explosion. Shortly after the attack police forces in the area launched a large security operation.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: An IED of unknown origin exploded in Kulbiyow (33km SW of Badhaadhe) targeting a KDF rotation convoy on 30/12. First reports indicate that one KDF vehicle was damaged by the explosion but human casualties are expected but are not known so far. The KDF convoy was on its way to Badhaadhe.

Unidentified armed militia stormed Belet Xawo prison to free a man who was earlier arrested by the local police for being an al Shabaab suspect on 28/12. The armed militia managed to free their man without any casualties but later engaged in an armed battle with the local police who mobilized after the attack in the outskirts of the town. At least seven casualties including civilians were reported from the battle.

Three people were killed and two others injured after an explosion went off in a vehicle within Mandera town on 28/12. Al Shabaab suspected. The explosion caused a group of locals to hold a demonstration against military forces, mistakenly believing members of the military had been responsible for the deaths of the civilians.

Three people were killed and two others injured after an explosion went off in a vehicle within Mandera town on 28/12. Al Shabaab suspected. The explosion caused a group of locals to hold a demonstration against military forces, mistakenly believing members of the military had been responsible for the deaths of the civilians.
Two police are attacked on 27/12 along the Lafey-Elwak road, Mandera county. Two others reported dead as well. No immediate claim of responsibility, though al Shabaab are suspected.

A member of al Shabaab, attempting to plant a roadside bomb, dies when the device exploded prematurely. The perpetrator was believed to be hurried when he saw that the police had noticed his activities and attempted top stop him. A matter of dispute, the Daily Nation reported police had killed the perpetrator, followed by the explosion.
Four police officers are feared dead following an al Shabaab attack on Bodhei, Lamu County on 25/12.

A brief armed clash erupted between newly trained SNGF and a local police officer after the SNGF ordered the police man to put down his weapon. The soldiers took his gun and no casualties were reported. After negotiation, the gun was returned to the police officer.
OLA forces attacked government troops and police on 22 December in Moyale town in Borena district, killing five soldiers and wounding three others.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills bus two travellers and wounds three others south of Mandera between Kotulo and Daba (Another report indicate the attacks occurred near El Wak) in Mandera County on 21/12.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills three police officers outside Mandera on 21/12. The attack may have been coordinated or related to an attack on bus travellers in the area.
Two are killed during a gun battle between al Shabaab and security forces in Milihoi.

A roadside bomb or landmine, suspected to have origin with al Shabaab, detonates in Mandara, targeting and killing a group of five (later determined to be seven) police officers. The landmine was planted inside the customs and border compound. The attack come a day after an ambush on a group of soldiers in the town.
IED attack against KDF near Beled Xaawo (14/12). The device was planted by al Shabaab. Causalities not known or reported.
Suspected al Shabaab ambush a group of soldiers in (or near) Mandera on 13/12, killing one and wounding two others.
Police arrested and hit students in Hidilola following protests against the master plan the previous day.
People protested against the government agenda in Hidilola as part of the second round of Oromo protests.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters (suspected ISIL faction) attacked Bulla Barwaaqo Check point (5km NW of Dhoobley) in the evening of 08/12. The attackers take over the village and torched down a house belonging to the chairman of the settlement and left after about 30 minutes. Further reports from the locals indicate that there was large numbers of al Shabaab fighters movement in the area along the border. No causalities reported.

Armed clan militia from Habar-Yaqub sub-clan of Marehan attacked and raided the office of the DC in Belet Xaawo in the morning of 06/12. The exchange of gun-fire between the local administration forces and the clan militia lasted for nearly one hour before the militia withdrew. No casualties were reported. The Haber-Yaqub are accusing the local authority to have released five murderers without trial killing Habar-Yaqub clan members. Local authorities made several arrested related to the fighting the following day.
An AP police officer opens fire indiscriminately on people in Hulugho on 06/12, injuring one. Authorities are attempting to ascertain if the attack was al Shabaab related.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: An AMISOM-Kenyan convoy hits an al Shabaab in Dhobley killing five soldiers.
Al Shabaab attacks Kenyan forces in Lamu on 06/12, seven soldiers killed, ten wounded.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: AMISOM-Kenyan aircraft bombed Yaraa Lafagari and Diif in Lower Juba region, where members of the pro-Islamic State [ISIL/ISIS] Al-Shabab faction are based. It is reported that al Shabaab/ISIL sustained causalities, though specific numbers are not known.
Garissa residents protest frequent water supply problems on 30/11.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Jubaland forces killed a Jubaland soldier in a shoot-out in Hoosingo Village (Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 28/11. The victim reportedly defied an order from his commander went to his home. He was killed after he opened fire at soldiers who were ordered to arrest him. A woman bystander was also injured in the shoot-out.
Al Shabaab lays siege to on Wajir on 27/11, but are quickly repelled by government soldiers. No reported death or injuries.
Al Shabaab overtakes Bula Golol in Garissa Country without resistance, then begins preaching to the residents. Military forces had fled the area prior to the al Shabaab arrival.
A soldier was killed and six others injured in the border town of Hulugho after an Al Shabaab IED detonated. Al Shabaab, in taking credit, claims eight dead.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a former al Shabaab member in Beled Xaawo Town on 21/11. The victim defected from al Shabaab and surrendered to SNG forces in Beled Xaawo where he was allowed to run his own business. No one has so far claimed responsibility for the killing.
Ethiopian-OLF forces and Kenyan police clash in Sololo on 19/11, three police dead. The clash began following an OLF invasion in the area.

A member of al Shabaab escape police, takes the officers weapon and fires several shots. Hundreds of officers cordoned off the area and engaged the suspect in a shootout until he ran out of bullets and was arrested. The suspect was injured.
Al Shabaab kidnaps a teacher at a refugee camp Hagadera. The victim was rescued four days later.
Six killed and twelve are wounded in a drive-by style al Shabaab shooting in Beled Hawo.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Kenya Defence Forces(KDF) conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab positions in Wadajir and Dalayad villages (38kmNE and 25km N of Badhaadhe) respectively on 01/11. As a result of the airstrikes 17 al Shabaab fighters including two senior commanders were allegedly killed.

KDF convoy shot and severely injured a camel herder boy in Darasalaam (141 KM SW of Baardheere District) on 27/10. The reason is unknown and the convoy continued with their travel. Relatives took the boy to Wajir/Kenya for treatment.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM Kenya forces in Badhaadhe on the evening 26/10, inflicting 'huge losses.'
Locals block the Mpeketoni-Lamu road in protest of pothole problems. The protest disrupted traffic for two hours.
A teacher is kidnapped by suspected al Shabaab in Hagadera refugee camp. The teacher was later rescued by Kenyan forces across the border into Somalia.

On 12 October 2015 at 10:30, an INGO vehicle travelling without escort was stopped by a group of five armed men who had fired shots in their direction. The men kidnapped a non-local female Kenyan from the vehicle and fled after coming under fire by police.

Two groups from Beled Xaawo local forces clashed in the morning of 04/10. Reports indicate that the clash is reportedly related to clan conflict and previous clan revenge killing in the town. Local traditional elders intervened and managed to separate the two fighting groups. Two combatants were killed while nine others including civilians were injured.
Al Shabaab launched an attack in AMISOM-Kenyan forces at Dhamase village. The ambush attack on KDF convoy killed and wounded several people including both warring sides, numbers not known.

Armed clash took place between KDF and al Shabaab in Likooley Village (96km SW of Beled Xawo) in the afternoon of 24/09. The clash took place when an IED was identified by a KDF convoy. Once the convoy slowed down, al Shabaab started shooting which lasted for about an hour. Another KDF convoy coming to reinforce was also ambushed on the way. A KDF helicopter arrived to support the convoys which overwhelmed al Shabaab. The KDF convoy proceeded towards Ceel Cadde. No casualties were reported. The clash caused a large displacement of the area population.

source: Radio Freedom Voice of the Ogadeni People
notes: ONLA fighters and government forces fought a heavy battle in Kebri Amadin, Dolo province. Six enemy soldiers were killed and eight others were wounded in the fighting

Al Shabaab suspects abducted two youth Darood/Ogaden, Mohamed Zubeer travellers using Toyota Pajero from road junction 30km NW of Hoosingo Village (96 KM NW of Badhaadhe town) on 20/09. They were later released.
Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM-Kenya forces outside of Dhamasa; KDF returned fire, killing three of their attackers.

Al Shabaab fighters launched ambushed against KDF military convoy Likooley (99 KM SW of Belet Xaawo) and Dhamase (104 KM SW of Beled Xaawo) on 19/09. Reports indicate that al Shabaab started the ambushes with IED explosion before fighting took place. Causalities not known.
Residents of Bula Rahma village in the outskirts of Garissa town protest a water shortage in their area.

Some SNGF based in Beled Xawo rebelled against the order to deploy in Garbahaarey on 23/08. They were disarmed by force by the SNGF commander. One soldier was shot and killed during the exercise while twenty more were disarmed and transferred to Doolow.
A suspected cattle thief is lynched by a mob at Archers Post location.
Mandera residents held a demonstration to press the government into deploying teachers to the region.

A SNG soldier opened fire at a vehicle of a civilian over an apparent unknown dispute in Beled Xawo in the evening of 21/08. The man died instantly and the SNG soldiers managed to escape and is said to have fled to Doolow.
Teachers in Garissa protested over deteriorating education standards in Northeastern.

Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Hoosingo (98 KM NW of Badhaadhe) and Kulbio (33 KM SW of Badhaadhe) on 16/08. No incident was reported.

Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Hoosingo (98 KM NW of Badhaadhe) and Kulbio (33 KM SW of Badhaadhe) on 16/08. No incident was reported.
Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Dhoobley (118 KM SW of Afmadow) on 16/08. No incident was reported.
Al Shabaab forces briefly take over Basuba in Lamu Country. Once there, al Shabaab leaders addressed the town and met with elders before retreating.
Turkana attackers kill five in a suspected cattle rustling operation. The attack caused tension in the area.
An al Shabaab-planted explosive attached to a military vehicle causes seven soldier deaths.
KDF soldiers killed three al Shabaab when they repulsed an attack at Basuba, Lamu county, on Wednesday (29/07) morning. Three members of the military forces were injured.
Students of St Pauls Kiwanjani Secondary School protest violently after several students were sent home over disciplinary action. A teacher was reportedly assaulted.
Reports indicate that Al Shabaab overtook Milimani village in Lamu on the night of 18/07. No violence was reported.
A KDF convoy was hit by an IED planted on the road close to Likooley village. The convoy was travelling from Ceel Cadde to Wajiir through Dhamase. One vehicle was damaged. Causalities not known.

Reports confirm that KDF conducted an airstrike against Dhamase village (103 KM NW of Buulo Xaawo) in the early morning of 12/07. Residents report that at least 10 people are reported to have been killed including children who were in Holy Quran School. Dhamase is under control of al Shabaab but usually has no permanent presence in the village and clan clashes between Murule and Marehan are reported in the area. The reason is unclear why KDF bombed the village. KDF also bombed Nus Dariiq (83 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) and Laan Qurac (76 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) was bombarded and civilian casualties and livestock death were reported.

Reports confirm that KDF conducted an airstrike against Dhamase village (103 KM NW of Buulo Xaawo) in the early morning of 12/07. Residents report that at least 10 people are reported to have been killed including children who were in Holy Quran School. Dhamase is under control of al Shabaab but usually has no permanent presence in the village and clan clashes between Murule and Marehan are reported in the area. The reason is unclear why KDF bombed the village. KDF also bombed Nus Dariiq (83 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) and Laan Qurac (76 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) was bombarded and civilian casualties and livestock death were reported.
Al Shabaab targets police with an IED in Lamu on 13/07. Three deaths reported.
Al Shabaab attacks a police convoy, including a civilian bus travelling in Mkunumbi, no reported causalities.

Al Shabaab attacks Mandera town, throwing grenades into homes while people slept on 07/07. 14 dead. Al Shabaab later officially claimed responsibility, declaring they were specifically targeting Christians.

Armed men attacked a passenger bus on 07/07 at Mpekatoni border town. There were no immediate reports of any casualties. Police later report the attack was not carried out by al Shabaab, but rather an unidentified group of locals.
Nine are killed and six others injured on 01/07 following an attack by members of the Marhani clan of Somalia on Arabia.

Armed clan clash flared up for the 2nd time in one week in Dhamase (110 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) on 01/07 between Muruule and Marehan sub-clans. Reports indicate that 12 combatants from both sides were killed and a score of other were injured. So far no clan negotiations are reported and both sides are said to re-group.

Residents of Isiolo town in Eastern Province held a demo on 30/06 over the disappearance and abduction of several men. Hundreds of women held a peaceful rally demanding answers from the government. Many of the protesters accused the Kenya Wildlife Services for the disappearance of the men.

Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters initiated an armed clash and finally took over Waldena village (approx. 90 KM SE of Dhoobley) along the border line after defeating a militia, loyal to JL in the night of 27/06. Information is scarce as communication is switched off however 12 JL militia are reportedly killed. Al Shabaab took over the village where at the same time a clan reconciliation meeting was on-going.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Bosnia section of Dhoobley Town (120 KM east of Afmadow) where TIS/DAI is drilling a borehole which was guarded by Dhoobley police in the evening of 26/06. All communication was switched off after LA received a tip that al Shabaab fighters might advance towards the town. After 20 minutes of gun-fire exchange, which could be heard also in Liboi town, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three JLF and one al Shabaab fighter have reported died while three soldiers and one Kenyan engineer got injured.

An armed clash erupted between Murale and Marehan sub-clans in Dhamase (108 KM SW of Bulo Xawo on 25/06. One person was killed. Reports indicate that Marehan initiated the clash as revenge for the killing of one of their clan members by Murale on the Kenyan side of the border.
One person was killed and two others injured in an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen in Mandera Town on the night of 26/06. All of the victims are 'non-locals,' origin not known.
Al Shabaab fighters ambush KDF convoy near Likooley Village (96km SW of Beled Xawo) on 24/06. Causalities not known.
Three KDF members are injured in an al Shabaab IED attack Milimani on 21/06.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a chief of Erib location in Wajir on 20/06.

20 people are killed in Durogo [phonetic] in Mandera County in what has been described as revenge attacks by Garre [clan] fighters following the killings of their clansmen. Perpetrators are not known. Date unclear - source dated 17/06.

Five pastoralists are killed by unidentified gunmen at Wari walo village some 10 kilometres from Kenya border. Those killed were three children (two boys and a girl), their father and a close relative. The five had recently left Elmole in pursuit of pasture and water for their animals.

Al Shabaab attacks several locations of Lamu Island and were able to briefly overtake the area known as 'Mangai,' an area they found with little resistance. Other places attacked included a school and a military camp. Military forces eventually repelled the attackers. 'Several' casualties reported, eleven of which were recorded as al Shabaab. Later reports suggest a British-born member of al Shabaab (known as Thomas Evans or Abdul Akim) may have been a leader in the attack and is among the dead. Another suspect of the attack was apprehended on 20/06.
Marsabit non-local residents protest over insecurity following a recent spate of killings in which they were targeted.

Non-violent activity: Al Shabaab reportedly erects a series of road blocks between Garba Tula and Modogashe townships [north-eastern Kenya] for purposes of extorting money from motorists. Despite these assertions, the local government denies these claims. Exact date unknown.

Hundreds of residents of Dadaab took to the streets on 06/08 to protest over the alleged sacking of 13 local employees by the World Food Programme (WFP). Waving placards, demonstrators marched through the town before heading to the main UNHCR headquarters offices gate where they camped for several hours.
Local authorities organized a peaceful demonstration against the approved motion of no confidence by the Somali Federal Government in Mogadishu against the JL parliament. No casualties were reported.
At least three people were killed and several others injured on the morning of 06/06 in inter-community clashes at Lowangila in Isiolo County. The clash may be related to rights to cattle or land.

Suspected al Shabaab opened fire at a residential area of Wajir on 06/06, killing three persons. Officials and residents said the attackers were believed to have been seeking to kill a local administrator who lives close to the scene of the attack and is known to be on an al Shabaab 'wanted' list for speaking out against the sects activities in the region.

Two non-local residents of Marsabit are killed in mysterious circumstances by unidentified assailants. Non-locals claim that they are being targeted in assassinations by police. The police deny the allegations.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Belet Xawo town in the morning of 02/05. The clashes started when the local Administration forces spotted a former al Shabaab member (defector) carrying a gun in the town, the defector got the gun from the former Belet Xawo DC as he was staying with him since he defected from al Shabaab. One the guards of the former DC was killed in the clash while the defector was arrested and the former DC was called to Doolow to ease the tension, he is currently in Doolow for talks.
AMISOM-Kenya Air Forces launch an aerial bombardment against al Shabaab positions in Godindhabe area 35Km south of Balad-Hawo, along the border with Kenya. Casualties, injuries not known.

A vehicle transporting sugar from Kismaayo to Kenya was targeted with an IED in Hosingo village (97KM, NW of Badhaadhe District). The destroyed vehicle was part of a convoy that left the city of Kismaayo on 31/05. Resident reported that al Shabaab attacked JLF and AMISOM troops who reached the area to rescue the vehicle. No human casualties reported so far.

Dhulbahante and Shiekhal clans clashed over pasture after Shiekhal attacked animal headers from Dhulbahante in Dad Gumbi Grazing area (97KM NW of Badhaadhe town) in the morning of 01/06. Reports show that four people from both sides were killed while others with wounds were admitted to Dhobley hospital for treatment.
Al Shabaab creates a heavy presence in Lafey village effectively 'taking over' the village. The presence of al Shabaab caused several villagers to flee for safety.

Residents of Beled Hawo held demonstrations against 'colonial tendencies' of the Kenyan government on 01/06. The protest may also be related to a potential plan of the Kenyan government of construct a wall along portions of the border between Kenya and Somalia in an effort to protest border towns from al Shabaab attacks.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: A vehicle transporting sugar from Kismaayo to Kenya was targeted with an IED in Hosingo village (97KM, NW of Badhaadhe District). The destroyed vehicle was part of a convoy that left the city of Kismaayo on 31/05. Resident reported that al Shabaab attacked JLF and AMISOM troops who reached the area to rescue the vehicle. No human casualties reported so far.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: KDF forces, based in Khadijo Hagi (42 KM NW of Belet Xaawo) shelled areas around Gaddoondhowe (43 KM NW of Belet Xaawo) in the morning of 01/06. Casualties cannot be confirmed. The shelling came after reports were circulating about al Shabaab troop movements in the area.

A demonstration against KDF forces for destroying buildings on Somali Kenyan border organized by Beled Xawo administration took place in Beled Xawo in the morning of 30/05. All businesses in the town were closed during the demonstrations. No casualties or other problems were reported during the operations.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Beled Xawo District administration forces clashed with KDF forces in Beled Xawo over a border dispute on the 29/05. The clash started when Kenyan forces started destroying buildings on the Somali and Kenya border, Kenyan government is seemingly trying to construct a wall on the border between Somalia and Kenya starting from Mandera. The two sides exchanged a brief gunfire and a gun was taken from KDF side though it was returned to them after reconciliatory talks between two sides. No casualties were reported.

At least two people have been killed while five others were injured after two rival political factions clashed in Ceel Waaq on 28/05. Fighters loyal to the area deputy commissioner Sahal Maalin Adan and others loyal to a former Ceel Waaq district commissioner fought after Sahal was accused of being behind the killing of the former district chief.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Kenyan AMISOM soldiers kill seven members of al Shabaab in the southern town of Dobley.
Al Shabaab attacks a police post Yumbis on the night of 25/05, killing 20. Al Shabaab had also attacked the area the previous week.

A group of clan militias from Harti of Dhulbahante sub-clan attacked Sheekhal militias in Hoosingo Village (97km NW of Badhaadhe) in the evening of 24/05. The attack was in revenge of the killing of business man from Harti by Sheekhaal clan near Hoosingo. The clash lasted more than half an hour after which the Harti/Dhulbahante militias withdrew. Four civilians were injured in the clash. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established.
Al Shabaab gunmen attack Yumbis and Wel Marer villages in Fafi, each about 80 Km north east of Garissa. Security forces pushed back the attackers, no reported causalities.
Al Shabaab gunmen attack Yumbis and Wel Marer villages in Fafi, each about 80 Km north east of Garissa. Security forces pushed back the attackers, no reported causalities.
KDF air force bombarded places around Gadoon Dhowe (41 KM SW of Beled Xaawo) in the early morning hours of 20/05. Casualties not reported.
Al Shabaab 'catches two military posts (in Sangailu and Hulugho) by surprise,' no violence reported.
Al Shabaab 'catches two military posts (in Sangailu and Hulugho) by surprise,' no violence reported.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.
Ethiopian soldiers armed with AK-47 rifles cross into Kenya aboard 10 vehicles and reportedly take over a police station in North Horr.

Following the disappearance of three people residents of Kinna protest, accusing the Kenya Wildlife Service of kidnapping. The residents marched to the Meru National Park and allegedly set a fire at the park. One is killed and eleven injured after the police engaged the protesters.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF re-supply convoy close to Khadijo Hagi (39 KM SW of Beled Xawa) in the morning of 18/05. The ambush was initiated by a RCIED explosion followed by small arms fire. No casualties were reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed and attacked an AMISOM/KDF convoy in Hawindha (93 KM SW of Afmadow, on the road between Dhoobley and Tabta) in the afternoon of 16/05. Casualties are unknown but the convoy managed only to reach Dhoobley around 19:00 pulling two damaged military vehicles and one damaged Pro-Box civilian vehicle which was previously car-jacked by al Shabaab.
Two suspected Al-Shabab gunmen and a police officer killed in shoot out at Dadaab Hamey Patrol Base in Garissa.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Dhamase village, 105 KM SW of Beled Xawo without any armed clash with SNG forces in the night of 10/05/2015. They burnt down a military base for SNG forces, the al Shabaab fighters took over the village soon after SNG forces vacated the village after receiving info that al Shabaab fighters are planning an attack the village. No casualties were reported. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village in the early morning of 11/05.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: An AMISOM/KDF convoy was hit by a RCIED explosion in Kolbiyow, 33 KM SW of Badhaadhe District in the morning of 08/05. One Caspir was damaged in the explosion and four KDF soldiers were injured. The convoy proceeded after the attack and no other incident was reported.

At least fifteen people are feared dead in fresh attack among rival villages or groups in Baragoi, Samburu County. Eight people were reportedly killed during a raid at Lomirok early Sunday morning (03/05). Unconfirmed reports indicate that another six, among them women and children, were killed at Sarma along the Samburu-Marsabit border that evening.
A RCIED targeted the District Commissioner of Ceel Waaq on 03/05. Slight injuries reported.

Al Shabaab fighters killed two SNG soldiers and captured two others in a surprise against SNG forces manning a check point in War-Cadey neighbourhood of Beled Xawo in the night of 03/05. A small number of SNG forces were at the checkpoint during the attack.
Suspected Somali Al-Shabaab kidnapped two Kenyan teachers on the evening of 24/04 in the Mandera border town.

Heavily armed gunmen suspected to be members of Al-Shabaab on the morning of 23/04 kidnapped senior Arabia chief in Mandera County Kenya along the Mandera-Arabia road. The chief was driven across the border into Somalia where he was killed at Gadoon Dhowe, Beled Xawo District.

Heavily armed gunmen suspected to be members of Al-Shabaab on the morning of 23/04 kidnapped senior Arabia chief in Mandera County along the Mandera-Arabia road. The chief was driven across the border into Somalia where he was killed at Gadoon Dhowe, Beled Xawo District.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of Beled Xawo District Commissioner in the evening of 20/04. The hand grenade exploded in an empty area. Security guards at the residence opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator managed to escape. This is the second time in a span of two weeks in which the DCs residence came under attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: AMISOM (KDF) contingent conducted attacked al Shabaab base in Gheldezza area (90km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 18/04. Reports indicate that 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed and their weapons seized. Three KDF soldiers were killed and seven others injured.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: On 17 April 2015, officers from Kenya's anti-riot police, the General Service Unit (GSU), beat and kicked Nation journalist Nehemiah Okwembah and Citizen television cameraman Rueben Ogachi at Bombi village on the outskirts of the government-owned Kulalu Galana Ranch in Tana River county
Non-violent activity: Ten armed members of al Shabaab hijack a bus carrying ten passengers, deboard them and take the bus across the border into Somalia. No violence reported.
Al Shabaab fighters attack residence of the District Commissioner of Beled Xawo (12/04). Further details of the attack not known.
Defusal: Police uncover and remove an IED in Mandera County, near the Somali border on 12/04.

Kenyan war planes reportedly destroyed two al Shabaab positions Gaadondhowe Village (40km SE of Beled Xawo) on 05/04 in response to the Garissa University killing. The destruction of the camps could not be independently confirmed. Al Shabaab later denied their destruction.
Garissa residents protest a recent al Shabaab attack on a school in their town. Date unknown - source dated 04/04.

Al Shabaab gunmen attack Garissa University during the morning hours in an operation that lasted the majority of the day. Almost all of the 148 people killed were students and another 79 people were injured.

Al Shabaab gunmen attack Garissa University during the morning hours in an operation that lasted the majority of the day. Four attackers were killed during the siege, and the police are holding another five individuals for questioning.

At least one person was killed and three others injured on the morning of 01/04 when masked gunmen attacked a non-governmental organisations compound at the Dadaab Refugee Camp. The attack occurred during the early morning hours, perpetrators not known.
A man hailing from Ogaden/Awliyahan killed another man from Shiqal in Weel Cade (28km SW of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 26/03 following a dispute over pasture land.
A groups of youths protest the Mandera Deputy Governor during a rally in Mandara.
Residents of Mandera County demonstrate against recent area violence by al Shabaab. Date not known: source dated 21/03.
Hundreds of Mandera County residents took to the streets of the border town on 20/03 protesting over recent insecurity in the area. The protesters called for the removal of the county commissioner.

An IED exploded in the Somali-Kenyan border town of Belet Xaawo in the morning of 17/03. The explosion occurred at a place where vehicles wait and collect passengers from Mandera heading to other parts of Gedo region. No casualties were reported. Another IED explosion was also reported at the same time in the Kenyan side of the border, injuring two Kenyan Administration Police soldiers.
An IED explodes in Mandera following a similar attack across the Somali border in Beled Hawo. No reported causalities.
Four are killed and their bodies burnt in a grenade attack on a Wajir shop. Perpetrators not known.
Al Shabaab carries out the second attack in two days in Mandera. One death, three injuries reported. In the following days the death total was raised from 1 to 4.

Three people were killed and eight more wounded when al Shabaab launched a cross-border raid on a convoy carrying Mandera county governor Ali Roba. The governor escaped unharmed. The convoy was travelling either to or from Nairobi.
Al Shabaab attack, and then later claim responsibility for the death of four in Wajir. Three other injured.

On 12 March 2015, Al Shabaab fighters and pastoralists clashed in Hoja Wajeer Village (22km S of Badhaadhe). The fighting broke out al Shabaab fighters blocked the pastoralists and their livestock from accessing a water point in the village as a measure to enforce Zakat payment. Seven people were killed in the clash.
Teachers of a Mandera school are attacked and injured when students from a neighbouring school targeted them in blame for the cancellation of recent exams.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: An IED exploded near a water dam in Kolbiyow, 33 KM SW of Badhaadhe on 03/02 where JLF and AMISOM forces fetch usually water. Property damage, but no human casualties reported. Perpetrators are unknown and no arrests were reported.

Two men armed with pistols believed to be al Shabaab operatives have shot and killed a civilian hailing from Marehan sub clan of Daarood in Belet Xaawo town Gedo region in the evening of 02/03. It is believed the victim was attempting to mobilise SNG forces in the area.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Belet Aamin (4km NE of Belet Xaawo) in the evening of 26/02. The clashes erupted after one group attempted to take-over a check-point manned by the other group. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers were overwhelmed and had some of them arrested. No casualties were reported.

One person was killed and two others injured in an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen in Mandera Town on the night of 25/02. The victims were witnessed crossing from nearby Somalia at an earlier date and are suspected to be Somalis
Unknown assailants on the evening of 13/02 hurled two hand grenades at police officers on patrol in Wajir town. No reported injuries.

Three people were critically injured after a hand grenade was hurled at a food kiosk in Mandera town. The reason for the attack is not known. The perpetrators escaped. Authorities suspect one of the victims may have been linked to al Shabaab.
Students in Wajir protest a teacher shortage in the area.
Protesting the availability of jobs offered by a power company, residents block the a road leading to work site in Kargi for several days, holding hostage a truck driver ferrying supplies.
Protesting the availability of jobs offered by a power company, residents block the a road leading to work site in Kargi for several days, holding hostage a truck driver ferrying supplies.
Protesting the availability of jobs offered by a power company, residents block the a road leading to work site in Kargi for several days, holding hostage a truck driver ferrying supplies.
Protesting the availability of jobs offered by a power company, residents block the a road leading to work site in Kargi for several days, holding hostage a truck driver ferrying supplies.

Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped over 50 charcoal burners from Kidi Faani Village (31km SE of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 15/01. In Sadaxlogood Village (40km E of Badhaadhe), 25 charcoal burners went missing and are believed to have been kidnapped by al Shabaab fighters. Five charcoal trucks and three mini-buses are also reportedly missing and believed to have taken by the al Shabaab fighters. Reports indicate these villages are the main charcoal producers in the region. The charcoal is later transported to Buur Gaabo Village (43km SE of Badhadhe) along the coast of the Indian Ocean.
The Kenya Defence Forces killed eight al Shabaab and injured several others during an encounter with the insurgents in Basuba, Lamu county. A KDF soldier died while three others were injured.

A RCIED detonated in the outskirts of Khadija Haji village (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the afternoon of 08/01. Reports indicate that the target was reportedly SNG commander who was expected to be travel using that road. The device missed the target and seriously injured five civilians.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and injured an elder on his way to his residence in Baled Xaawo in the evening of 06/01. The motive is unclear. The perpetrators escape.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM convoy at Hawinaa near Tabta village (78km SW of Afmadow) in the evening of 06/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The convoy was heading to Dhobley when the incident happened. No casualties were reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against KDF convoy heading to a water point near Raas Kambooni village (78kms SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 02/01. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for a few minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three AMISOM-KDF soldiers were reportedly injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces on foot patrol in the outskirts of Khadija Haji Village (Beled Xawo District) in the afternoon of 29/12. Three SNG soldiers were killed. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established. The targeted SNG forces were recently deployed from Dollow.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Khadijo Haji (38km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 25/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two SNG soldiers were reportedly killed. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.
Two women are killed by unknown gunmen on Garissa.

A prominent cleric is kidnapped and later found dead (28/12). Perpetrators not known, though Muslim leaders blame police forces for his death. Further, it is not known if the kidnapping has any connection the killing of two women the same day elsewhere in the town.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG convoy in Buulo Xaawo village (57km W of Baidoa) in the morning of 24/12. The two sides engaged heavy fighting which lasted for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters were overwhelmed. The SNG forces left Qansax Dheere and were heading to Bardaale when the ambush happened. Two SNG soldiers and one al Shabaab fighter were killed while another al Shabaab fighter was injured.

One police reservist has been killed and another injured in Wajir. The report says weapons belonging to the two policemen were taken away by the unnamed attackers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility several days following the incident.

Unknown people hurled a grenade on the evening of 21/12 at a residential area in Mandera. The explosive was targeted at a group of people who were chewing miraa at Green View near the National Cereals and Produce Board depot around 7pm. No one was injured.
Non-violent activity: Suspected al Shabaab attack a Lamu bound bus in Nyangoro. Four shots were reported fired, though no one was reported injured.
AMISOM/KDF convoy was targeted with a RCIED in Buusaar Village (37km SE of Ceel Waaq) in the morning of 18/12. One truck was slightly damaged. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of pro-SNG forces (not named or identified) clashed in Ceel Waq in the morning of 15/12. The fighting broke out after pro-SNG forces allied to a replaced deputy District Commissioner attacked those of the new deputy DC who was appointed by the local authority. Both the former and the new deputy DCs hail from Marehan/Uur-midig sub-clan. One soldier was killed and another injured.

AMISOM (KDF) attacked Gadoon Dhowe Village (45km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 11/12. The two sides engaged in a fierce fighting in which KDF warplanes took part. Over a hundred al Shabaab fighters also were involved in the fighting which was reported as the deadliest of late in the area. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the new al Shabaab leader was present in the area during the clash. The sound of heavy gunfire could be heard in Beled Xawo town. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Gadoon Dhowe Village (45km SW of Beled Xawo) on the 08/12 after AMISOM (KDF) vacated the village and moved to undisclosed location between Gadoon Dhowe and Khadija Haji (39km SW of Beled Xawo). AMISOM forces had initially overtaken the village from al Shabaab a week earlier.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack on AMISOM-Kenya forces base in Gadoon Dhowe (40km SE of Belet Xaawo) in the evening of 07/12. The two sides engaged in a fierce battle which lasted for hours after which the al Shabaab fighters were pushed back. Casualties could not be confirmed.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a surprise attack against AMISOM (KDF) base in Gadoon Dhowe (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the morning of 06/12. The two sides engaged in a heavy fighting that involved KDF war planes. Seven AMISOM soldiers and more than 30 al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the clash that went on for about two hours. The AMISOM soldiers were allegedly cutting firewood during the attack.

A KDF warplane, which conducted air strikes in Jamaame District, crashed in Dasheg Waamo, about 30km N of Kismaayo as it returned to the base in Kismaayo in the afternoon of 04/12. KDF claimed the plane had developed technical problems and crashed but the al Shabaab Waali (governor) of Juba, Sheekh Abdirahman Hudeyfa said al Shabaab fighters had shot down the warplane and the body of the pilot and wreckage of the plane is under their custody. Later, al Shabaab took the body of the pilot to Jilib for public view.
Al Shabaab lines and executes 15 non-Muslim farmers by firing squad in Mado Gashi.

An unknown assailant threw two grenades into a cafe in Garissa on Wednesday night, wounding two people. The source references several attacks from al Shabaab in the area, but does not speculate as to who is responsible for the Wednesday blast.

KDF warplanes bombed Bur Sagaar Village (18km SW of Doolow) and Qabri Sheekh (35km SW of Garbahaarey) in Gedo Region in the morning of 03/12. The warplanes also bombed other al Shabaab-controlled remote villages near Gadoon Dhowe and Tuulo Barwaqo in Beled Xawo District - these locations not named. Casualties could not be established. The bombing reportedly caused displacement of civilians in the area.
At least one patron is killed when suspected al Shabaab attack a country club bar in Wajir. Witnesses claim two blasts followed by gunfire.

Two pro-SNG forces (not identified) exchanged gunfire in Ceelwaq in the afternoon of 01/12. The shoot-out broke out after local authorities attempted to arrest a group of pro-SNG soldiers who shot in the air over unknown reason in the night of 30/11 but the soldiers defended themselves. The soldiers were later arrested. No casualties reported.
