A pro-al Shabaab website published a report that al Shabaab has claimed the responsibility of the killing of 36-non local Kenyans at a quarry in Koromei area near Mandera in the night of 01/12. The statement claimed that the attack on Koromei was part of series of attacks executed by the Mujahidin to serve as a response to Kenyas occupation of Somalia, the airstrikes by Kenyan warplanes and the killing of innocent Somalis.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: SNG/AMISOM (KDF) forces took over the control of Khadija Haji village, an al Shabaab base (38km SW of Beled Xaawo town) in the morning of 01/12. Al Shabaab fighters vacated the village prior to the arrival of the allied forces.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces in Gadoon Dhowe Village (40km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 01/12. The two sides engaged in a fierce fighting that went on for four hours after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly destroyed an AMISOM military truck using a RPG round. Casualties are unknown. AMISOM/SNG seized the village from al Shabaab on 30/11.
At least five people were wounded on Sunday evening after unknown men hurled a hand grenade at pedestrians in Garissa town, northern Kenya.

AMISOM (KDF) and SNG forces took over Gadoon Dhowe village an al Shabaab base (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the afternoon of 30/11. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters vacated the village after they got a tip-off about the news of the allied forces movements towards the village. No confrontation was reported during the takeover.
A Kenyan police officer was shot dead and another seriously wounded in an attack by suspected al Shabaab at Dadaab Refugee Camp.

Media reports indicate that Kenyan war planes conducted an airstrike in Gadoon Dhowe (40km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the evening of 22/11. The airstrike was allegedly in retaliation for the killings of 28 Kenyan nationals who were killed on 21/11 in Kenya Somali border by al Shabaab fighters after they were picked up from a bus they were travelling with. The extent of the damage caused by the bombings is not known. Deputy President William Ruto of Kenya later suggested that over 100 members of al Shabaab were killed in the air strike.

At least 28 people were killed after suspected Al-Shabaab militants attacked a Nairobi-bound bus in Omar Jilo, Mandera County in north-east Kenya. Witness said the attackers ordered all off the bus, divided the passengers along ethnic lines - Somali and non-Somali, shooting all non-Somalis. Many of the deceased were teachers.
At least five people were killed and four others reported missing following clashes in Dukana, Marsabit County or rights to cattle and property.

At least eight people were killed and four others seriously injured in inter- communal clashes in northern Kenyas Isiolo County. The clash reportedly lasted for several hours. The clash occurred at Leruko on Isiolo side, a few meters from the bridge that connects Isiolos Buffalo Springs game reserve with Samburu Park.
A gunman shot at a INGO vehicle at Garsaal (45km NE of Ceel- Waaq) on 07/11. No casualties.

Al Shabaab attack against SNG forces in Warcadoy village 4kms SE of Belet Xaawo in the afternoon of 05/11. The clashes allegedly lasted close to an hour after which the al Shabaab fighter withdrew. As a result, a woman was killed, no other casualties were reported.

A group of youths threw stones at Administration Police officers on night curfew patrol in Lamu. The officers were pelted with stones from a rooftop. No reported injures. The rioters were adverse to the curfew.

One person was hacked to death and four others seriously injured in a fresh attack in Bora Moyo village of Kipini. The violence began when a militia from Garjel community attacked the town when they believed its residents had stolen a herd of goats.
Traders in Lamu protest for a second consecutive day. Police reported involvement.

Lamu residents have again taken to the streets to protest the continued extension of the night curfew which has been in force for more than three months now. Police were deployed to disperse the protesters.
Twelve people were injured, four of them critically at Bula Sheikh in Garissa town when unknown assailants hurled a grenade at a shop.

KDF forces kill five suspected al Shabaab fighters who were attempting to drive an explosive laden car into Kenya from Ethiopia. Mandera is situated at a point where a border is shared by both Ethiopia and Somalia.
200  Muslims demonstrated against the 6pm-6am curfew in [Kenya] on Lamu Island. The group asserted the curfew hurts the local fishing economy.
Unknown gunmen killed a police officer near the border with Somalia before escaping.

A senior Kenyan county official escaped death narrowly after an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded as he was being driven to his office in the border town of Rhamu, Mandera. Perpetrators not known. Two injuries reported.

Five passengers in two Miraa [mild narcotic] vans from Lamu to Ijara town were during the morning hours hijacked by suspected al Shabaab militia, which was later confirmed. The incident took place between Milimani and Basuba area in Lamu East sub-county. The five were taken to an unknown location. Kenyan security forces launched a search mission in response.
Two men Degodia men looking for their lost donkeys were attacked by Garre militia at Bula Dawa, Rhamu sub county, one death, one injury. The two clans have a history of rivalry.

A RCIED apparently targeting a teashop frequented by SNG soldiers in Kabooley market (Baled Xaawo) in the afternoon of 28/09. Two civilians were reportedly killed while a SNG police man and a civilian were injured.

Six people have been injured in a grenade attack in Kenyas north-eastern district of Garissa. The report said a grenade was thrown by unnamed attackers on Ngamia Road near the district hospital. Though the attackers have not been identified, the source references a history of al Shabaab attacks in the area.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab targets AMISOM-Kenya soldiers in Badhaadhe for the second time in two days. Two AMISOM vehicles were reportedly destroyed in the battle.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab launches an attack on AMISOM-Kenya forces in Badhaadhe Distirct, exact location not known. Two AMISOM deaths reported.
At least eight are killed in twin grenade attacks in Wajir. Assailants not known.
Unidentified Somali assailants attack a kill a Garissa trader and injure two others in the early hours of the morning. Protests against this action continued throughout the day.

Residents of Garissa protest the killing of a trader at the hands of suspected Somali assailants. The protest degenerated, however, into a violent clash between Somali and non-Somali groups causing the police to the disperse the rioters with tear-gas.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: AMISOM/Pro-SNG forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters based at Lagta Berta (25km SE of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 14/09 where both sides reportedly engaged heavy fighting. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Anti-terrorism police forces gun down a suspected and wanted al Shabaab member during an early morning raid on their hideout. It is believed the target of the operation was responsible for the killing of a German tourist.
Degodia fighters attack and kill two members of the Garre clan in the Darkale area of Mandera County.

One civilian is killed and two police officers injured in an attack on a lorry carrying supplies for a food programme. The attackers are unknown, but are believed to be related to an ongoing clash between the Degodia and Garre clans.
A Somali soldier shot and killed two of this colleagues in Gadoon Dhowe, near Beled Hawo, and surrendered to al Shabaab, presumably to defect.
Suspected al Shabaab attack a police post with grenades, but did not cause bodily harm or property damage.

Non-violent activity: A gunman attempted to kidnap a local female UN staff in the outskirts of Beled Xaawo in a food distribution site in the afternoon of 27/08. Reports indicate that other militias in the area managed to rescue the individual unharmed. The reason behind the failed abduction is currently unknown.

Eight people are feared dead after about 200 heavily armed Garre militia from Ethiopia carried out an attack on the Degodia-dominated town. The attackers, who were dressed in military fatigues raided Banisa in Guba Sub-Location and targeted shops, villages, a school and a dispensary. The two clans have been recently been clashing in the area.
Six are reported injured following a explosion near a hospital in Mandera. Perpatrators unknown, though the attack may be related to a nearby ethnic clash between Garre and Degodia clans.
A clash between Garre and Degodia clans continue into a second day. Two additional combatants killed. The Garre may have been from Ethiopia, who came later to reinforce the Kenyan Garre.
Unidentified gunmen attack an ambulance near Mandera (Isaack Kora town), injuring the driver. The attack may be in relation to a nearby clash between Garre and Degodia clans.

Kenyan warplanes bombed Godoondhawe Village (79km SE of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 24/08. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters vacated the village before the attack. Casualties could not be established.
Twenty dead (range as high as 30) and 300 displaced as a result of a seven-hour ethnically driven gun battle in Rhamu. Police have made at least one arrest and recovered various light arms.
Samburu and Borana herders clash over a water source. Four killed, two each side.

A group of al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush against SNG military convoy from Luuq passing on Maykaareebi village (15km NE of Garbahareey) in the afternoon of 21/08. Reports indicate that the ambush was followed an armed clash which lasted for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Six al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed while a SNG soldier was apparently injured. The convoy proceeds to Garbahareey after the clash.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: AMISOM (KDF) warplanes bombed al Shabaab bases in Khadijo Haji Village and Gaddoondhowe villages (39km and 82km SW of Beled Xawo) in the morning of 20/08. AMISOM and al Shabaab fighters also clashed in the two villages. Allied forces were able to overtake and gain control of Gaddoondhowe. Casualties could not be initially established, though it was later learned 17 were reported dead in total.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills two, steals vehicles at Basuba location, Lamu East. Security forces later launched a security sweep of the area.

A khat driver is kidnapped by al Shabaab while three of his colleagues were attacked, robbed and released as they travelled in or near Bothai, possibly Kiunga. It was later learned the driver was beheaded sometime later.

Suspected al Shabaab attack a police post in Bothai around the midnight hour between Monday and Tuesday. The ensuing gun battle lasted five hours, eventually causing the police forces to abandon their post. After the police fled the gunmen ransacked the village, stealing drugs. Deaths reported, though no hard numbers were provided.
Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly kidnapped 22 people from North-eastern Kenyan district of Mandera. The perpetrators later released the group after taking their possessions.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a quarry worker before fleeing into Somalia. Authorities speculate the motive for the attack is related to the presence of Kenya troops in Somalia.
Suspected al Shabaab, numbering 5, killed a road construction worker in Mandera County before fleeing across the border into Somalia.
Two casual laborious were shot dead by unknown assailants, later suspected to al Shabaab in the outskirts of Garissa town on the evening of 13/08.

Two police officers were injured during the evening hours injured after al Shabaab gunmen attacked a police station in Mandera. The gang of about 100 is said to have attacked at the Fino Police station in the night using rifles.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Beled Xawo in the noon of 07/08. The fighting broke out after a group based in Bulo Xawo attacked the other which reportedly stole a PKM (heavy machine gun) from other SNG forces based in Garbahaarey. The Garbahaarey group reportedly withdrew and later left the town to unknown destination. A civilian bystander was reportedly killed.

Gunmen hurled explosives at the Mandera county government headquarters causing damages. The buildings wing that houses finance and other executive offices was destroyed in the attack. Perpetrators believed to be al Shabaab. No injuries reported.
Two SNG soldiers exchanged fire over land dispute in Beled Xawo in the morning of 02/08. One of the soldiers was injured. The other was arrested by SNG forces.
Two are shot and killed in Garba Gola by unidentified gunmen. The reason for the killing is not known, but it should be noted one of the victims was Somali.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters carried out hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNG position in Khadijo Hagi village 42kms SW of Belet Xaawo in the evening of 25/07. Heavy fighting lasted approximately an hour, and heavy machine guns and artillery shells were fired by KDF. Casualties on both sides could not be established.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Suspected al Shabaab fighters overrun a JLF check-point and taxation point for goods going to Kenya and to Kismayo on the 24/7 in the early afternoon. The road-block was located at Shabaax village (approx. 20Km SE of Dif-(Dibi).The three JLF (Jubaland Forces) manning the check-point were allegedly killed by al Shabaab without resistance as they were not anticipating an attack. Suspected al Shabaab remained the whole day and night at the tax station before they left the following morning again in anticipation of JLF reinforcement from Dif and Afmadow.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Kenyan AMISOM gain control of Khadijo Haji after a series of airstrikes earlier in the day which caused al Shabaab to flee their positions.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Kenyan warplanes bombed Khadijo Haji (39km SW of Beled Xawo) in the night of 24/07. No casualties were reported. It is believed that the airstrike was in reaction to the reports of al Shabaab movement near Beled Xawo.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Forces belonging to the African Union Mission to Somalia (Amisom) captured a camp used by Al-Shabaab to train militants in the Gedo area of Bula Hawa. No causalities reported.

Unidentified attackers threw two hand grenades at a residential house in Section Kowaad (Dhobley) in the evening of 19/07. Reports indicate that Jubaland soldiers were living in the house. One of the devices detonated inside the building while the other one failed. A Jubaland soldier and a civilian were killed and another soldier was injured. AMISOM forces arrived at the scene discovered the unexploded device and later arrested a man in the neighbourhood in connection with the attack.
Unidentified gunmen attack a Mombasa-bound bus outside of Witu, kill seven, including police officers. The following morning al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Police officer candidates protest unfair hiring practices by the police forces.

Residents of Ngumu village in Tanadelta sub county protest against harassment by police in the ongoing operation to root out street gangs that have been killing people in the past month. The residents allege the police force witnesses to publicly point out gang members, which causes them to fear attacks from the gang.
In response to recent attacks in the Lamu area, Kenya air forces launch attacks on Lamu Forest, believed to be where the suspected assailants are hiding. Causalities not known.

Fresh attacks have been reported in Ras Kitua area in Lamu. Reports say gunmen raided villages in Manda Island, stole household goods and torched several houses before disappearing into Boni forest. Lamu County Commissioner Miiri Njenga says they are conducting aerial patrols to hunt down the attackers. Causalities not listed. The attack may have had occurred on 14/07.
Unidentified assailants attack Pandanguo location, no immediate reports of causalities.

At least one person was killed and several injured late in the day in the grenade blast in a restaurant in Kenyas north-eastern town of Wajir, before spraying the building with bullets and escaping. No one claimed immediate responsibility for the killing.

Thousands of protesters demonstrated in Mpeketoni over insecurity . They carried placards and twigs as they appealed to the government to curb runaway crime. They condemned the recent killings in the county and asked for speedy investigations .

A group of 30 to 50 armed men, believed to be attached to the recent attacks in Hindi, attack Gamba police station (Ndeu area) during the evening hours. The attackers overpowered the security officers the torched the station. One officer reported dead, two others injured. Shabelle Media Network reports nine officers dead.

A RCIED planted in a restaurant frequent by SNG soldiers and other people who were not observing the month of Ramadan exploded in Kabooley Market in the afternoon of 06/07. Two SNG soldiers were killed and several others were injured. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
At least 12 people were killed when attackers managed to get a suspected ringleader of Mpeketoni attacks out of a police station in Kenyas Tana Delta County.
At least 21 people have been killed in new attacks late in the day in Kenyas Lamu coastal region. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: Suspected Liyu Police paramilitaries assassinate a ONLF sympathiser along Kismayo Road in Garissa.
A man is lynched for allegedly killing his brother.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: A RCIED was targeted against an AMISOM (Kenyan contingent) convoy near Buusaar Village (38km SE of Ceel Waaq) in the afternoon of 28/06. The device is believed to have been planted and detonated by al Shabaab fighters. The convoy had left Ceel Waaq and was heading to Buusaar Village when the explosion happened. Unconfirmed reports indicate that an AMISOM soldier was killed and a truck damaged in the explosion.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: The KDF war-planes conducted an airstrike targeting al Shabaab fighters in Jadecaley village (19km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 24/6. Casualties could not be established.

Between 10 and 15 suspected al Shabaab assailants attack Witu. A witness said that the attackers shot their victims first, made sure they bled, before tying them up and making them lie on the ground facing down. They then proceeded to hack them. The attackers are said to have vowed that they were not going to leave until they eliminate all non-believers from the area. At least 11 dead. The attack may have occurred in Maleli. As a result of the attacks, many of the residents have fled the area.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/pro-SNG (not identified) convoy passing in the vicinity of Dida Adey (23km SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 23/6. Reports indicate that heavy fighting followed the ambush which lasted for about two hours after which the attackers withdrew. Two pro-SNG soldiers were killed and their bodies brought to Kolbiyow for burial. Casualties from the attackers sides could not be established.
At least 20 (some reports 30) have been killed in ethnic clashes in Tarbaj involving the Degodia and Garre clans. The fighting stemmed from a boundary dispute. The clash may have occurred on 21/06.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a private residential house frequented by government soldiers in Beled Xaawo in the evening of 22/06. Reports indicate that three soldiers were reportedly injured. The perpetrators escape from the scene.

Five suspects linked to the two Mpeketoni attacks have been shot dead in Bochai area in Mpeketoni, Lamu county by security personnel. The ministry say three AK 47 guns and several bullets were recovered in Bochai after the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed two motorcycles transporting khat in the vicinity of Dhamase Village (105km SW of Beled Xaawo) in the afternoon of 17/06 but they managed to pass the ambush. No casualties were reported.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: An ONLF sympathiser narrowly survives an assassination attempt from suspected Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitary gunmen. Suspicious of three men that entered a cafe he was patronizing, the target grabbed one of his would-be assailants, using him as a human shield. The ONLF target was shot, along with his human shield, multiple times and taken to a hospital in Nairobi. The attack was an apparent retaliation for a ONLF launched attack on a man known as Sheikh Abdi Rashid.

Residents of Mpeketoni in Lamu County have held protests in the town following the killing several people by gunmen on Sunday and Monday nights. The residents held placards and lit bonfires in the town to protest the deaths and the destruction of property by suspected al Shabaab militia which occurred on Sunday followed by fresh attacks the previous evening.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/Somali government forces convoy near Ceel Waaq in the morning of 17/06. The ambush started with a detonation of a RCIED followed by direct confrontation between the two sides. The convoy had left Ceel Waaq and was heading to Ceel-Cadde (50km SW of Garbahaarey) when the incident happened. Three al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed. AMISOM/SNG casualties could be established.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab insurgents ambushed an AMISOM convoy outside Ceel Waaq while it was en route to Eel-Adde. Causalities not know, but one the vehicles was burnt by the attackers.

At least 10 more people were killed during the night-time hours in a second attack in Mpeketoni, Porokomo, Lamu County area by al Shabaab. Police said gunmen raided Poromoko village and set several houses ablaze. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack claiming they had killed 20 police and wildlife wardens. Other sources claim 15 deaths.

Somali al Shabaab carjack two police vans in Witu, drive to Mpekatoni where they began opening fire on people in the street. It was later learned the attackers singled out-non Muslims before they opened fire. Areas affected were Mpeketoni Police station, two hotels, a bank and a fuel station. One of the hotels was burnt down in the attack. It is not clear if police forces returned fire. Out of the 60 people reported missing after the Mpeketoni clashes 8 people are yet to be accounted for. At least 57 people died in the attack.
An unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade along Ngamia Road area in Garissa injuring seven civilians.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
notes: A suspected member of the Liyu Police shoots and kills a ONLF sympathising shopkeeper, throws a dud grenade into a crowd, flees, is tackled by a group of villagers and is arrested by police.

SNG forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Bulo Xawo Village (20km S of Berdale) in the morning of 04/06 after receiving a tip-off about the presence of the al Shabaab fighters in the village. The al Shabaab fighters withdrew after brief exchange of gunfire. No casualties were reported.
Two unidentified pro-government militias exchange fire for unknown reason. Causalities not known.

Two men, suspected to be Somali al Shabaab, attack a group of police and military personnel, and are shot. Following the attack residents protest the killings, asserting that at least one of the attackers were known Sheikh in the region.

55 Ethiopians were reported killed by ONLF over the last 3 months during battles at Towrane & Dabile in Degehabur province, Adadley & Irey in Duhun district, Sanka-danke in Birkod, Burayska in Hamaro district, Dudihabred in Denan district, Labiga in Sagaga area, and Maragududshe, Gelnujis & Gurumo in Garbo district

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018) Liyu Police
assoc_actor_2: UWSLF: United Western Somali Liberation Front
notes: A prominent Muslim religious leader and UWSLF leader was shot dead by suspected Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries in Garissa [north-eastern Kenya] town on Sunday [1 June] night just 24 hours after one person was killed and three others seriously injured. The motive for the killing is believed to be related to the victims support of the Ogaden separatist government in Ethiopia and the ONLF. The victim had previously survived an assassination in 2012.

Two men, suspected to be Somali al Shabaab, attack a group of police and military personnel, and are shot. Following the attack residents protest the killings, asserting that at least one of the attackers were known Sheikh in the region.

A grenade attack at a garage in the eastern Kenyan town of Garissa left one killed and three people wounded. The motive for the attack, which took place close to the Somali border, was not immediately clear.

Twelve people from the Degodia clan were during the nighttime hours killed when militia from the Garre clan raided Gunane village in Tarbaj constituency. Seven others are admitted to the Wajir District Hospital with serious injuries. Wajir county commissioner Naftali Mungathia said the militia stormed the village at around 11pm and hurled a rocket propelled grenade at the villagers who were asleep. Conflicting reports hold 18 deaths.

Suspected al-Shabaab militants killed two Kenya Defense Forces (KDF) soldiers and injured another at the common frontier with Somalia, police have said. The divisional police commander, who confirmed the incident, said the officers were attacked by the insurgents who emerged from the bonny forest along Lamu-Malindi road on a Pick-Up vehicle.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM convoy passing the road between Tabta and Dhobley in the morning of 24/05. Reports indicate that both sides used heavy weapons after which the attackers retreated back. Two suspected al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a family in Bosnia section (Dhobley) in the evening of 22/05. Reports indicate that the attackers were reportedly targeting an al Shabaab defector, who reportedly escaped with money collected as Zakat. The former defector exchanged fire with the attackers and managed to escape. A young girl was killed in the shootout and an old man and the wife of the targeted defector were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

Unknown assailants attacked an Interim Jubba Administration official in Dhobley during the nighttime hours. The attack resulted in the killing of the officials son and the wounding of his father and wife. The identify of the attackers remains unknown.
Report over video of residents of Holeta in Oromiya Regional State protesting against the recent violence in the regional state
Suspected al-Shabaab militants hurled grenades in co-ordinated attacks against civilians in Garissa town Tuesday evening (May 20th), injuring ten people.

actor1: Police Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Three unidentified armed men conducted a hit and run attack against Dhobley Police station in the night of 19/05. Reports indicate that the attackers shot the police from a nearby mosque. No casualties were reported. Jubaland forces conducted a security operation and arrested three persons suspected of having a link with the attack.
Somalia based al Shabaab fighters attack a truck carry khat in the Mandera region which sparked a clash between they and security reservists. Twelve reportedly KIA.
Three men are killed in clashes suspected to be between the Degodia and Gare clans over a boundary dispute in Wajir County.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
notes: AMISOM forces launch heavy weapons toward Puntland positions in Beled Hawo following a clash between ASWJ/SNG and Puntland forces. Causalities not known.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: ASWJ/SNG forces and Jubaland Interim Administration forces clashed in Beled Xawo in the morning of 13/05. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged fiercest fighting which took several hours in the northern side of the town. Death toll reportedly reached 12 combatants from the warring sides. Further reports indicate that the Jubaland forces have been pushed back though each group is mobilizing for reinforcement. AMISOM Ethiopian contingent fired artillery after the clash renewed for the second time. Many residents fled the area to avoid the violence.

Unidentified assailants attack a prominent 'peace-builder' and local elder during the evening hours. Durng the attack al-Sunna wal Jamma militia came to the elders aid, rescuing him, and clashing with his assailants. The clash 'resulted in causalities.'

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Unidentified armed men shot and killed a Jubaland soldier in Dhobley in the night of 07/05. The motive behind the killing could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Defusal: Police discover and dismantle an explosive planted at the Boys Town Primary School in Garissa. Police believe the target of the explosives was the school children. Perpetrator unknown.

Local authority forces (ASWJ/Somali government) and pro-Jubaland militia led by the former District Commissioner of Doolow clashed in Bulo Xawo in the midday of 05/05. The two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. The fighting stopped after the intervention of ENDF. Five people-two combatants and three civilians-were killed and 10 others (combatants) were injured in the clash.

The governor of Gedo survived an assassination attempt on his life after an IED bomb was tied to his vehicle. Two of his bodyguards were killed, several other passersby injured. Perpetrators not known.
A group of 30 members of suspected al Shabaab attack a power station. Police respond, killing two and recovering weapons. It is nor clear if there were any civilian injuries.
A group of 30 members of suspected al Shabaab attack a power station. Police respond, killing two, arresting one and recovering weapons.
A prominent peace builder is killed during the late night hours as he left a mosque. The assailants are not known.

Three unidentified gunmen shot and killed a traditional elder in Kabooley market in Bulo Xawo in the evening of 26/04. The reason behind the killing is unknown. Unconfirmed reports show that the victim was opposed to plans to put Gedo Region under Jubaland administration. The perpetrators escaped.

Residents of four villages in Mukogodo division, Laikipia North subcounty held a peaceful demonstration against a private ranch for being sidelined in employment. The residents from Lekiji, Ilmotiok, Koija and Tiamamut said Mpala Research Centre is sourcing for workers, including watchmen and guides from outside the subcounty.

Two to four armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab, approached a vehicle (a UN agency vehicle) of the Kambioos-bound convoy stationed along the Hagadera hospital road and shot the driver on the right arm in the morning of 23/04. The second occupant of the car, an expatriate staff managed to get off the car and ran towards the nearest INGO compound for help. Both of the driver and the expatriate are currently safe with the driver undergoing treatment at the Hagadera hospital. The perpetrators escaped with the vehicle and drove south-east of Hagadera for approximately 30 km when the vehicle was remotely disabled, prompting the perpetrators to leave the car. Police reached the scene and were combing the area for the perpetrators. The attack was ;later revealed to be a kidnapping attempt against the UN staffers.
Al Shabaab forces launch a hit-and-run style attack against Somali forces at Buusaar. No reported causalities.

An unknown number of assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Wajir in the early hours of the day, hurling grenades and firing their weapons, with no casualties reported. The attackers also stone a number of weapons from the post.

A renown Somali peace seeker and businessman known as Shire Dhalabow was shot by two unidentified gunmen in north-eastern Kenyas border town of Mandera. The assailants who were boys of the ages between 14-17 years.

Two loud explosions were heard during the night-time hours at Dadaab Refugee Camp airstrip. It is believed that an al Shabaab affiliated camp militia was targeting security forces near the airstrip with grenades. The third grenade was thrown, but it failed to detonate. No reported injury or death.
Warring between the Auliyan and Abdiwak clans causes the destruction of homes and the displacement of many in Qabobey, Garissa county. No causalities reported.

One person was shot dead and another is fighting for his life at the Mandera Hospital after sustaining serious head injuries after suspected al Shabaab shot them at close range. (Though authorities believe al Shabaab is responsible, they also speculate job rivalry may have been a motive for the attack.

More than 150 families from Manda-Maweni village in Lamu county have protest the alleged grabbing of a quarry. The families stormed the county government offices and demanded that a tycoon in the area be ordered to leave.

Residents of Mukogodo division in Laikipia North district demonstrated against 'sand theft'. They said they have been deprived of revenue. The residents obstructed the Ilpolei-Doldol road for several hours, blocking lorries that transport sand from the collection points.

An unknown number of armed men carried out an armed attack against the Central AP camp in Mandera in the night of 13-14/03. Employing multiple vectors, they first lobbed two hand grenades into the camp and subsequently fired against the police for a few minutes before departing the scene. One Police reservist was killed and another wounded in the aftermath of the attack. The KPRs were reportedly having a small break after long hours of patrolling around that area. The perpetrators reportedly crossed over to the Somali side of the border after the attack.
Residents held a peaceful demonstration over the poor state of Mpeketoni District Hospital.
Two al Shabaab members are killed by police during a raid in the Dadaab refugee complex.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurl hand grenades at a border post, but caused no injury. It is believed the ordinance may have partially malfunctioned.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against pro-Somali (not identified) and AMISOM/Kenya positions in Buusaar village (Ceel Waaq District) in the night of 05/03. Casualties are unknown.
Bondeni residents in Mvita constituency protested over the increased use of drugs by youths.

Six people were injured during a confrontation between farmers and pastoralists at Mtondoni area in Hongwe ward, Lamu West district. The conflict ensued when pastoralists were accused of driving their animals into the farms and destroying crops. The identities of the two groups is not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: An Unidentified gunman shot and injured a Jubaland soldier in Dhoobley Village (Afmadow District) in the evening of 26/02. The motive is unknown. The victim was admitted to AMISOM hospital where he later succumbed to his injuries. The perpetrator escaped. Jubaland forces conducted a major security operation after the killing and arrested more than 50 people the following morning. Most of the detainees were released except for six suspects. The operation continued on 28/02.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM (Sierra Leone) convoy in an area between Dhoobley and Tabta villages (118km SW and 75km SW Afmadow) in the midday of 24/02. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire. Casualties could not be established.

Two nomad families from Habarwarsame and Celi sub-clans of Marehan clashed over a borehole in Sunujo Village (35km SW of Bulo Xawo) on 09/02. The two sides reportedly used machetes, axes and arrows during the clash. Seven people were injured in the clash. Clan elders went to the area to try to end hostilities. Other reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters separated the two sides.

Two groups of ASWJ forces clashed in Bulo Xawo in the mid-day of 08/02. The fighting broke out when ASWJ forces tried to arrest seven ASWJ fighters for disciplinary action and disarm them. The group refused to surrender and fighting broke out. Three ASWJ fighters were injured in the clash.

A RCIED targeted a tea-shop frequented by pro-government soldiers and local officials in the centre of Bulo-Xawo town in the afternoon of 02/02. Three civilians were reportedly killed. A nearby fuel shop was also hit, triggering a second explosion. The perpetrators escaped from the scene and no arrests were made. The District Commissioner of Bulo-Xawo blamed the al Shabaab movement for the attack.

Nine are feared dead in Moyale as fights between Borana and Gabra-Burji militia. On the morning of 30/01 suspected Gabra-Burji militias attacked Kate village, some 50 kilometres from Moyale town. The Borana group responded with heavy resistance. After about half an hour of intense exchange, the fights moved from the village into the bush. As at 11am fierce exchange was heard towards Funan-nyata about 15 kilometres from Kate.

Jubaland authorities staged a large demonstration in Kismaayo, Dhobley and Afmadow on 26/01 to oppose the deployment in the Jubas of additional AMISOM troops from different countries and the reduction of the AMISOM/Kenya contingent.
Two civilians are killed in the Kenyan border town of Beled Hawo during the evening hours by unknown men armed with AK 47 rifles.

Unidentified masked men armed with pistols shot and killed two former al Shabaab defectors in Bulo Xawo in the night of 24/01. Reports indicate that the victims were former al Shabaab fighters who had defected to ASWJ/Somali military forces in Gedo Region. The two men were coming out of a restaurant when they were shot. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Somali forces shot at a vehicle of Jubaland forces in Dhobley in the afternoon of 21/01. Reports indicate that five Jubaland soldiers were injured in the shoot-out. The motive behind the shooting is reportedly related to the arrest of two Pro-Somali Government commanders on 19/01 in Dhobley after stating that Jubaland authorities have categorically said that revenue have to be shared between the police and army; which Dhobley administration didn't agree to and instead arrested the two officers.

Unidentified militia, believed to be from nearby Ethiopia attack the ethnic Gabra border town of North Horr, killing two police and injuring 'scores' of civilians. It was reported cattle was stolen in the raid.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.

Three IEDs were detonated in the vicinity of firewood distribution centre in IFO 1 (Dadaab District) in the morning of 08/12. Reports indicate that the first explosion targeted the rear police escort vehicle of the regular morning convoy to IFO 1 and Dagahaley. The second set targeted the police responders, of whom a number had by then arrived at the scene. No one was injured by any of the blasts. The police vehicle initially targeted by the perpetrators only sustained slight damages. There were gunshots fired by the police after the second explosion. One man was injured in its aftermath, trampled by a panicked crowd running from the scene.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.

An unknown number of people are feared dead (coded as 3) and several others injured in Marsabit following fresh attacks by bandits believed to be from Ethiopia. The attack comes just days after four people were killed in the relative area over a water hole dispute, though it is not clear if this attack was motivated by ethnicity.

Four people were killed at Odha area, 15 kilometres from Moyale [northeastern Kenya] town following fresh tribal skirmishes in Moyale District between the Boranas and Gabbras. The clash was believed to have been sparked by the use of a water hole. The clash took place during the evening hours. In an effort to maintain order, military reservists were sent to the area in the following days.

An explosive device believed to be an IED targeted a police vehicle in the vicinity of Juba Primary School in Dagahley Camp in Dadaab District in the morning of 30/12. The police vehicle was escorting an NGO vehicle carrying out borehole refuelling. One police officer was reportedly injured by the explosion. The vehicle was severely damaged.

Unidentified warplanes attacked Jadecaley Village (19km NW of Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 24/12. Reports indicate that the planes took off from Kismaayo airport. No civilian casualties were reported. Al Shabaab casualties are unknown.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Government forces backed by Kenyan troops have clashed against Al-Shabab militants in southern Somali town of Kulibiyow. The fighting erupted after a group of Al-Shabab fighters carried out a surprise attack on the Somali and Kenyan army bases in the area. Causalities not known.
At least two people were shot dead, and four others injured in a gun attack in Wajir town. This is the second attack in a week. A gunman shot the victims indiscriminately before escaping.

Two people were killed and at least three others injured in two explosions targeting police officers in the north-eastern Kenyan town of Wajir. The explosions took place near the Baraza park in the town. The injured were taken to Wajir general hospital. Reports say there have been several arrests in connection with the explosions.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a border town, killing three civilians and five police. Liboi hosts an AMISOM military, often used to supply forces in Somalia.
Ethnic clashes continue near Moyale on 07/12. 'Dozens' reported dead.
Seventeen are killed in ongoing ethnic clashes over a 36 hour period Butiye village in Moyale town.
Seventeen are killed in ongoing ethnic clashes over a 36 hour period Butiye village in Moyale town.

At least 12 people were killed with many others injured in Marsabit county of northern Kenya following clashes between rival militia groups, Borana and Burji, Gabra. The clash caused 30,000 nearby Moyale residents, fearing for their safety, to flee north into Ethiopia. Clashes were sporadic throughout the week, though no specific date is provided. Some sources have causality totals at 70 or more.

A device suspected to be a RCIED targeted pro-government forces (not named) on patrol in Ceel Waaq in the afternoon of 03/12. One pro-government soldier and two civilians were killed and eight others, including civilians, were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab attacks quary workers near Mandera on 02/12, killing 38.
Suspected Borana militia attack two lorries in the Sololo and Woldaa areas outside Moyale, which are a few kilometres apart. No reported causalities.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: A RCIED targeted AMISOM forces passing in Hawindha Village (94km E of Afmadow) in the morning of 25/11. One AMISOM truck was damaged in the blast. The explosion was followed by heavy exchange of assorted firearms that could be heard in Dhoobley town. The convoy had left Tabta and was heading to Dhoobley when the ambush took place. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab attacks a civilian bus near Mandera, killing 28

A group of youths in Mandara stoned cars, burnt tires and engaged police in protest of the arrest of their friend. Fifteen of the protesters were arrested as a result of the demonstration. Police report they had sustained injuries.

A pro-Somali soldier shot and seriously injured a business woman in Bulo-Xawo in the night of 19/11. The woman - a Khat seller had engaged an argument with the soldier over previous khat debt. Other pro-soldiers arrested the perpetrator. The woman succumbed to her injuries later.

Two families hailing from the Mohamed Zubeyr sub-clan clashed in Dhoobley town (Afmadow District) in the evening of 13/11. The incident was related to an escalated land dispute. Reports indicate that a Jubaland soldier was injured in the shooting after he tried to separate the two sides. Elders have been mobilized to solve the issue. No arrests were reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Suspected al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM base located 3km outside Dhoobley town (Afmadow District) in the evening of 08/11. An exchange of artillery fire was also reported with most rounds being fired from the AMISOM side. A civilian woman was hit by a stray bullet and was transported to AMISOM hospital for treatment. No other casualties were reported. Reports suggest that the attack was coordinated with another one occurring in Hoosingo at the same time.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM base in Hoosingo village (70km SE of Dhoobley) in the evening of 08/11. Reports suggest that the attack was coordinated with another one occurring in Dhoobley at the same time. The fighting lasted for an hour. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attacker threw a hand grenade at a hotel hosting a government delegation in Bulo-Xawo in the evening of 05/11. The device landed in near the hotel but did not cause any casualty. The perpetrator escaped. The delegation is on a fact-finding mission on the cause roots of conflicts between ASWJ and local administrations.
Journalists in Northern Kenya took to the streets to protest a recently passed media bill which they believe would set limits on the press freedom.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM supply convoy near Dhoobley (Afmadow District) in the morning of 04/10. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. The convoy had left Dhoobley and was heading to Afmadow. Casualties could not be established.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Somali government soldiers, backed by African Union peacekeepers, have clashed with Al-Shabaab fighters on the outskirts of Kolbiyow. Fighting lasted for over an hour. Government forces report the deaths of 30 al Shabaab fighters.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a AMISOM/KDF and Jubaland forces convoy in Hariira village (15KM N of Kolbiyow) in the morning of 02/11. The ensuing clash lasted for around two hours as al Shabaab militiamen were pursuing the joint forces back to their base in Kulbiyow. Eleven deaths, unconfirmed.

A university student is killed and one shot in the leg by police in demonstrations in Maralal over insecurity. Several shops and offices have closed in the area due to fear of looting as protestors engage police in running battles.

Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa militia and Somali government soldiers clash. The SNG soldiers were apparently trying to secure a position in Ahmed Madobes administration through force. Two combatants were killed.
Government forces took control of numerous localities within Badhaade District after a 48 hour military operation. Causalities not known.

Tensions ran high in Dhoobley town after an anti-al Shabaab soldier hailing from Mohamed Zubeyr/Reer Isaq-Ali sub-clan who earlier killed another anti-AS soldier (Mohamed Zubeyr/Reer/Isaq-Harun sab-clan was killed on 19/10. Reports indicate that the two sub-clans were supposed to negotiate on blood compensation but the murderer was killed over night and his body dumped on the roadside, contrary to the agreement on public execution.
Four people have died following inter-Tribal conflict in Waso Rongai Village, Baragoi. The groups involved were not identified.

Two masked men armed with AK type rifles came to a small cinema in block N-29 of IFO 1 in Dadaab District in the night of 17/10. The motive of the attack is unknown. Six people were injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped. It is believed the attackers are affiliated with al Shabaab.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against anti-al Shabaab/AMISOM forces based in Kulbiyow (33km SW of Badhadhe) in the evening of 16/10. The fighting lasted for 30 minutes after the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Majority of the local residents fled the village during the clash. Reports indicate that the fighting caused tension in the village.
Renewed ethnic clashes in Moyale Monday (October 14th) injured at least five people and led to parts of the city being shut down.
A young boy is killed and three others injured after a landmine detonated in Mandera border town. The group many have been playing with the mine, not aware that it was dangerous.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM positions in Baadhaade, causing 'heavy battle.' Two killed, others wounded.

On 12 October 2013, the OLA unit ambushed Ethiopian government troops at a place called Laga Laku in Guto Gida District, East Welega Zone, killing one soldier, seriously wounding four others and capturing a number of AK47 rifles

Al Shabaab fighters loyal to Godane clashed with the loyalist of Abu-Zakaria in Godan Dhowe (40km S of Bulo-Xawo) in the evening of 12/10. Reports indicate that the pro-Godane militia attacked the village in order to capture Abu Zakaria, who reportedly crossed the border to Kenya the past few days. Abu Zakaria is believed to be a close ally of Sheikh Aweys and disappeared shortly after Aweys surrendered to authorities in Himan and Heeb. Unconfirmed reports indicate that he had facilitated the escape of Aweys from Baraawe by boat.

Armed men believed to be part of the anti-al Shabaab forces attacked and injured a local administration official and his body guards in Bulo-Xawo in the midday of 11/10. The motive is unknown. The victims were taken to Mandera Hospital (Kenya) for treatment.

Three people were killed and three others injured in an explosion that targeted a small coffee shop near the central police station in Beled Hawo. Among the dead include two police officers and a civilian, others wounded. Other sources claim all victims were members of security forces.
An unknown group attacked a Giriama village near Kipini in the Tana River Delta, burning three homes.

A RCIED targeted anti-al Shabaab soldiers seated in a teashop in Bulo-Xawo in the evening of 07/10. The device was planted in the tea-shop which is frequented by the soldiers. The local police commander and a soldier were killed in the attack while three others, including civilian, were wounded. The perpetrators escaped.

Two anti-al Shabaab soldiers (affiliation not named) exchanged gunfire following dispute believed to be related to extortion money at road-block in Bulo Barwaqo Village near Dhoobley in the morning of 06/10. One soldier died while the other sustained injuries.

Suspected al Shabaab operatives/sympathizers hurled two hand grenades at a video hall in Tima Cade neighbourhood (Bulo Xawo) in the evening of 01/10. The attackers also opened fire at the explosion. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

The Yiaku community living on Kurikuri Group Ranch in Mukogodo division protest at the border of the Kurikuri and Makurian group ranches in what they alleged was bias from the provincial administration over a land division conflict.

Police sentries in the main Mandera Police Line reportedly opened fire in the night of 27/09. The reason behind the shooting is unclear. Reports indicate that although police claim to have been fired upon, there is no evidence that an attack took place.

Suspected al Shabaab attack Ifo refugee camp in Dadaab, targeting an international aid organization staff residence in the refugee camp, which is one among the five open air complex camps in region. There was no injury.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: AMISOM/Somali forces clash with al Shabaab in Kulbiyow sub-district in the Lower Juba region. The clash lasted for several hours; causalities not yet known.

Al Shabaab fighters, reportedly ten in number, attacked the Central Administration Police camp in Mandera in the night of 26/09. The attackers exchanged small arms, hand grenades and RPGs for about 30 minutes after which they withdrew. Three vehicles parked in the compound got burnt in the fighting. Initial casualty reports indicate that two police officers were killed and one seriously wounded. One perpetrator was wounded in the attack. A conflicting report by the Nairobi Star holds three police deaths.

Al Shabaab attackers hurled a hand grenade at a group of police officers patrolling the Army/Airport road near Basabra Supermarket in Wajir on the evening of 25/09. The police opened fire after the blast. A second explosion was heard shortly after the first. The cause of the second explosion is currently unclear. One person was killed and three others were injured. Police arrested an injured man they believed to be one the perpetrators.
A Isiolo tomato farmer is killed at Isiolo-Meru border in what the security agents say is a revenge attack from the Meru.
Garre and Degodia militia clashed at Meriley water dam in Banissa District in the afternoon of 16/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No causalities reported.

Al Shabaab militants shoot and kill two civilians at Mandera, a Kenya/Somali border town. On Thursday night, two police officers were seriously injured after a hand grenade was hurled into their vehicle.

Unidentified men riding in a taxi hurled a hand grenade at a police vehicle passing by the Nairobi Hotel in Manderas main market in the evening of 05/09. The group then directed small arms fire at the police, forcing the police to withdraw quickly, before their damaged vehicle broke down along the road to the police station. Three police officers and a civilian (a cashier at the Nairobi Hotel) were injured in the attack. The attackers managed to escape the scene without suffering any casualties.
A device suspected to be an IED exploded in front of the Central AP camp in Mandera in the evening of 05/09. No casualties were reported.

A Raskamboni militiaman opened fire at a group of civilians in Dhoobley in the morning of 01/09. One woman was reportedly injured. The incident was reportedly related to a land dispute between the militiaman and some other residents. The shooter was arrested.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found. Many residents have fled the area.

The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Security measures: The District Commissioner of Dhoobley banned the presence of 'takfir' sect in Dhoobely town (Afmadow District) on 23/08. The DC made the announcement in a local mosque after the Friday prayer. After the statement, members of the group were reportedly spotted heading to Dadaab refugee camp in Kenya, while others went underground.
Kenyan forces stationed in Madera County chase several al Shabaab fighters into Beled Hawo following cross-border gunfire. Causalities not known.
Kenyan forces stationed in Madera County chase several al Shabaab fighters into Beled Hawo following cross-border gunfire. Causalities not known.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. Specifically, this days clashes were in the Oda and Hellu area. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty Al-Shabab militiamen are killed by the Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] near the border town of Hulugho, Garissa. The militants were crossing the border to Somalia and are believed to be part of a group of nearly 40 militiamen who attacked an Administration Police camp at Galmagala Division last Friday [16 August] evening killing four Administration Police officers.

Armed men shot and injured three civilians in Bulo Xawo in the morning of 20/08. The incident occurred after the victims tried to oppose the installation of electrical poles in the town by a businessman escorted by armed men. Reports indicate that shooting is related to a electric company losing their service monopoly in the town.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Heavy fighting broke out between AMISOM/KDF and al Shabaab fighters in Kulbiyow Village (33km SW of Badhaadhe) in evening of 18/08 after al Shabaab fighters attacked the position of KDF. Casualties could be established.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/KDF in Badhaadhe in the night of 16/08. The two sides exchanged both light and heavy gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. A civilian woman was injured in the clash. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established.

About 20-30 al Shabaab fighters attacked Galmagala police post in Fafi District in the evening of 16/08. The attackers used small arms and RPGs during the attack. Four administration police officers were killed and local teacher was injured in the attack. The attackers also set fire to the police post, destroying its complex of buildings. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack on its Twitter account, claiming to have killed five police officers and seized weapons and communications equipment.
Human rights activist Hassan Ali was shot dead, allegedly by army officers, and three people were injured following anti-government riots on Wednesday.

One person has been gunned and three others injured in Moyale following a confrontation between rioting locals and security personnel in the area. The injured include two civilians and one officer attached to the Moyale police station. During the commotion residents also set fire to offices belonging to the Assistant County Commissioner and looted other locations. The rioters demanded the national government transfer top administration and security personnel in Moyale sub-county. Military personnel was sent to the town following the riot to quell the demonstrators.
Over 60 heavily armed Pokot bandits attacked residents of Nachola village in Baragoi, injured an eight-year-old boy and stole a large number of cattle.

Reports reaching the Ogaden Online service desk confirm that Ogaden National Liberation Army (ONLA) [armed wing of Ogaden National Liberation Front, ONLF] commandos have attacked the Wafdhug Ethiopian military barracks

source: Radio Freedom Voice of the Ogadeni People
notes: ONLA ambushed Military soldiers in Labiga Boskele near the village of Wafdug. Casualties listed as unknown, coded as 3.

Al Shabaab militias ambushed a vehicle transporting local security forces based in Afmadow on the alternative road linking Afmadow and Dhoobley in the morning of 18/07. Four soldiers were killed and three seriously injured.

A group of Boda Boda Riders (motorcycle group) gather to protest the killing of two of their colleagues by gangsters. The group called on the police to investigate the case. Police dispersed the group with teargas and made over 120 arrests.
'One security guard for an NGO was shot when he interrupted what was likely an attempted armed robbery of an NGO compound in Dadaab.'
Ukasi residents protest a recent spat of killings in their area. The nature of the violence is not clear. The group gathered along Garissa-Mwingi road.
Residents of Wajir gather to protest the delay of a sewer building project.

40 people, including two government officials, were held hostage by gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab militia from Somalia in Hullugho border town. The gunmen apprehended the group while the were travelling from Masalani.

A demonstration in protest against the involvement of KDF in recent clashes in Kismaayo was held in Ceel Waaq in the morning of 01/07. The governor of Gero spoke at the event and declared the KDF was an enemy and a destabilizing factor in the region.

Resident of Bulo Xawo on 01/07 staged a demonstration in protest against KDF involvement in the armed clashes between Ras Kaambooni forces (RKB) and those loyal to Barre Hirale in Kismaayo on 29/06. A man affiliated with Raskamboni opened fire in the crowd, injuring one of the demonstrators.

Two patrolling units of AS and anti-AS forces are reported to have clashed near Buusaar village (Ceel Waaq District) on 11/02. Casualties could not be confirmed.

A pro-AS website reported that AS militias had ambushed a KDF convoy in Al-Willa village, around 20km E of Ceel Cadde. The website reported that the AS fighters had killed seven Kenyan soldiers, injured 23 others and destroyed two Kenyan armored vehicles. The report could not be independently verified (Som).

AS militias and Ras Kambooni/KDF forces clashed in Dalayat (around 20km N of Badhaade on the road to Kismayo) on 07/02. Details of the fighting are currently unclear. The Ras Kambooni Spokesman declared that anti-AS forces had taken control of the location and its surrounding areas. Media reports indicate that anti-AS forces were supported by Kenyan warplanes and that AS retreated to Wadajir, around 20km NE of that location, also on the road to Kismayo. The AS on their side reported that they had killed nine KDF soldiers and destroyed three military vehicles, and had two fighters killed and three others injured. The AS account adds that the attack is the fourth against the KDF in the last three days and that the casualty of KDF since 04/02 grew to 18. The location of the engagement, from Badhaade towards Kismayo, shows however that the AS were clearly on the defensive.

An AS mobile unit reportedly ambushed a vehicle with six anti-AS militiamen on board in Carro Case. One of the passengers was killed. The remaining five men reached Bulo Xawo later in the day. Alternative account of the event suggests that the fighting in fact broke out between two groups of anti-AS forces, one of which previously left Garbaharey without an order.

Somali Islamist rebels stormed a remote police camp in northeastern Kenya, killing seven people and kidnapping three. The town was four miles from the border and known as Gerille. Among the dead were three police, a civil servant, school teacher and a pregnant woman.
